All Reviews

  1. A Great Buy, Thank You.
  2. okay option for a 5 oclock shadow shaver. like the vaccuum feature... saves a lot of cleanup. battery lasts pretty well. buut razor usually takes 2'3 passes over a given area to get good consistent trimming. also difficult to get into nooks and crannies of a face such as between upper lip and note.
  3. This is a very good product and I would give it five stars without hesitation if the claim that it &#34;does not make a mess while trimming&#34; were true. The reality is that about 80% to 90% get sucked into the trimmer's container, which is great, but it also means that the remaining 10% or 20% end up in your sink. Don't get me wrong, I prefer this much over the alternative products that dump everything into your sink or next to it. If you use the trimmer with the turbo function, you get a decent suction and also a decent cut as long as you use the contour following comb. To get a good and even result, it is best to trim the same areas from at least 3 or 4 different directions, as the comb is not very fine and doesn't catch all the hair. I have not had any problems with the hair container door -- other customers complained about it being flimsy but I find it easy to use and sturdy.<br />The bottom line: This is a fantastic product, much better than all the other options. If Philips could bring themselves to drop the false advertising, I'd given it immediately five stars.
  4. Exactly as described and works as it should. Thanks!
  5. The quality you would expect.
  6. It is as promised and expected. I'm happy. Thank you.

  13. Pulls hair on normal speed, works perfectly on turbo (no pulled hairs). Blades are sharp and cut welll, but don't use for fine detail or very close shaves. Vacuum feature is a gimmick - do not buy for that feature alone. The compartment fills up quickly and the overflow just sprays about your bathroom like mushroom spores. But I only bother shaving when I look truly overgrown so this may not be an issue for those who trim daily. Think of it more like a good ride-on mower as opposed to a lawn edger.

  19. As a satisfied owner of a Norelco T980, I was pretty interested in the idea of a replacement trimmer that was quieter, lighter, offered better battery life, and wouldn't have any battery memory issues (the T980 used Ni-Cad batteries). The QT4070 delivers in all of those areas. However, it suffers quite in a bit in an area where the T980 shined: quality. I've had my T980 since 2008/2009 and while the battery isn't very good these days, it still works perfectly. I purchased the QT4070 in September 2013 and Norelco is about to send me my FOURTH replacement under warranty. The first trimmer died completely after a couple months. It just wouldn't turn on right after shutting it off, I couldn't get it to show any signs of life on the charger either (I'm guessing the Li-Ion battery just failed). The other three have all succumb to the issue with the trimmings door others have shared here. The plastic notch that holds it shut is just too flimsy/fragile and breaks off after a few months of normal use. It's a shame, because this is a nice trimmer overall and it just seems like a huge waste of resources. Philips could easily remedy this, but they probably consider it too minor of an issue to spend money on. Though, I do commend them on issuing replacements without any hassle whatsoever. Minor Update - 7/5/2015: I should also mention, I've had a handful of instances where the battery just kind of &#34;quits&#34; when using the trimmer fresh off the charger. I usually have to stop to empty the trimmer and/or add/remove one of the combs after using it for a few minutes. Sometimes, it just refuses to turn back on and shows that the battery is dead. Very annoying.
  20. Had a Philips beard trimmer for 6 years and still have no issues with it. Decided to upgrade!
  21. Hard to trim mustache.
  22. Amazing, if you have a beard you need one. Best Trimmer on the market
  23. This trimmer is powerful, has great battery life and a good length selector. All of that would be enough to buy it.<br />The vacuum feature though. Oh that sweet vacuum feature.<br />I'm not saying it gets all of the hair, but easily 80% of the hair is sucked up into the little vacuum compartment.<br />Your wife is tired of you leaving little beard hairs all over the sink, this helps with that. In a way, you're getting this for the health of your marriage.<br />Seriously though, this is a great trimmer, I would highly recommend it.

  28. I bought this to replace a T980 Philips Norelco beard trimmer that was about 6 or 7 years old. This model is more powerful and has better controls. I think the battery is better, but its not fair to compare it against an old unit.<br /><br />Great news. Mine came with two combs. The one that was on the trimmer in the box is the one most people are complaining about. The other one is the contour following comb. Norelco must be listening.<br /><br />The only feature I can complain about is the vacuum. It works and is okay, but it is not nearly as effective as the T980. The T980 had a spring-loaded lip this model doesn't have. I am guessing it increased the suction on the T980. I would still buy this unit again, even over a new T980 if it was available. I always had to clean up a little hair afterwards and a bit more won't make a big difference.<br /><br />One note of caution. The door for the compartment holding cut hair protrudes a bit on the right hand side. At first I figured it opened on that side, but pulling it didn't do anything. Be sure to open on the other side, I can see that a good pull on the wrong side could break the door.
  29. Update 2013-06-17: Product was received in less than 2 days. The contour comb was included and so far, impressed with the product.<br /><br />Original Entry:<br />Having read so much about the contour comb issue, I chatted with Philips-Norelco and got the following information. I'm giving this 3 stars without even laying eyes on the product. The chat was brief, to the point and satisfactory. I will come back and update when I receive the product.<br /><br />Mack: Hello Jim.<br />Jim: Mack.. I'm interested in ordering a QT4070/41, but there is a bunch of complaints as to whether the unit comes with a contour comb. Your site shows one, but the manual doesn't mention it. On Amazon, the same page shows that it has it and doesn't have it. Make sense what I'm asking?<br />Mack: I totally understand your concern and will be glad to help you.<br />Mack: Jim, we have reported this issue and the new QT4070 now includes the contour comb.<br />Mack: The contour comb is now included with the new QT4070 package.<br />Jim: Do you think a new amazon order will include it, or would they have inventory dating back before it was included?<br />Mack: Unfortunately, we do not have that information.<br />Mack: Jim, you can purchase the unit. If you do not receive the contour following comb then you can contact us and we will replace it for you.<br />Jim: Sounds good. Thanks.<br />Mack: You're welcome, Jim.<br />Mack: Is there anything else that I can help you with today?<br />Jim: Nope. You were very helpful and spot on. Thanks for the feedback.
  30. In the past I have almost exclusively used razors to shave. This has been problematic since I would often get lazy and let my scruff grow out and then trying to shave would not be a pleasant experience. I received the QT4070 today with a nice mantle of scruff today. I took it out of the box, popped on the contour head, plugged it in, and was shaving away in just a couple of minutes. It cut through my scruff with ease and the contour head did a great job of doing it evenly. For those who have complained about the vacuum not working well I would imagine you had a fairly good beard when you did this. My first pass left a fair bit of hair in the sink, but this is partially because I filled up the vacuum chamber quickly. I emptied it and went for another pass with almost no hair flying around the bathroom. The turbo setting makes this even handier.<br /><br />So, all in all, I would say get this product if you are looking for something that will leave you a little stubble and you are not wanting to do a detail trim. Also, I wouldn't worry about the alarming reviews cautioning about the potential to get cut with this product. I zoomed it around my face on the 1mm setting without a nick or a scratch. Just use it the way you are supposed to and you will be fine.<br /><br />Buy it! You'll like it!
  31. Bought it on March 14th, 2015 and it has failed to hold a charge more than a few days at a time; it reads fully charged but the next day it is dead. Because it has been 33 days (3 days past the Amazon 30 day return period), I can't return it to Amazon, so now I have to deal with Norelco. Shame I really like the features, it allows me to keep my beard neat and trimmed, and the vacuum works well. I can plug it in, and use it right away after it is dead, but if the battery is failing now, how long can it last? If Norelco is able to replace it with one that works as advertised, I will update this review with a more favorable rating. But for now I cannot recommend this product. Got off the phone with Norelco, and they are sending a replacement within 10 days, so I updated this from a 2 to 3 stars. If the replacement works well I will update this again.

  56. The QT4070/41 beard trimmer is very nice, I like the flexible head attachment and that the length adjustment is very easy to use. The vacuum function makes it so that very few hairs escape during the trimming as well
  57. This trimmer is not for short dirty looks. Since part of the teeth of the trimmer are uncovered. This makes the teeth be uncovered on one side and cuts the beard to a much shorter trim.   58. I use this as a body hair trimmer; so I can't address some issues people raise with beard trimming, but it works great for my needs. Turbo vacuum is the reason I use this model instead of a traditional body hair trimmer. It vacuums up the hair as I use it with no mess to clean up. It also trims a lot closer than the body groom model. I tried the 3mm setting with plastic guide against my skin and it felt fine. Then I tested the 2mm setting and felt a slight scratching of the blade against my skin, but nothing extreme and it cut really close. This replaces a Remington vacuum trimmer that died after many years. The Phillips-Norelco turbo vacuum is noticeably more powerful, it cuts a lot closer, has a lithium battery and can be used with the cord. So I can still use it after the battery dies years from now. It is sleek, maneuverable and the lighted digital display is cool. The Remington would not work without a viable battery. A common complaint regarding the swinging door hair trap wasn't a big problem for me. However, I see how it could easily snap off if you're not careful. It that happens I'll have to tape it shut with electrical tape and that will be a nuisance to empty the trap. Hair does not shake out as easily as with a removable trap, but the little tool brush helps sweep it out. If there is a lot of hair you can shake it out. I finished up by sticking a vacuum cleaner hose in there to get all the hair out in a second. Unfortunately, there are not a lot of products in the vacuum trimmer market. More competition would lead to greater innovation, but the Phillips-Norelco turbo vac trimmer does a great job for now.
  59. Trims well but door that holds trimmings is poor. I have bought 2 and both clips that hold the plastic door closed broke within a couple months of use.

  61. Very pleased with this trimmer. I like to keep short stubble and this works perfectly. I have had no problem with the adjustable spacer as previous posts have mentioned. It says it will go to .5mm, that is true but only if you remove the spacer attachment. It will go as low as 1mm with the spacer attached. I use this to stubble trim and use the norelco arcitec razor to shave necks and cheek area where I dont want stubble. All my grooming appliances are Norelco. I think they have top notch products.
  62. This maybe the most poorly though out and inadequately tested product that Norelco has ever released. The major flaw is with the plastic guard that is supposed to cover the blade. On all previous Norelco trimmer models the plastic completely covers the blade thus preventing the blade from cutting your face. On this unit, the Norelco engineers clearly decided to add an element of danger to the trimming process by modifying the design of the plastic guard, and thus leaving the blade virtually exposed on the shortest settings. This had to be done for a reason, because if this unit was properly tested before it was released to consumers, this design flaw would instantly come to light. Furthermore, the hair that it cuts varies in length depending on how you held the unit at the time of the trim. The vacuum function on this unit could also use some improvement. Although it picked up about 90% of the hair, enough hair was left on the bottom of the sink, to require further clean up. Don't buy this unit. There are better and cheaper units out there, that will trim your stubble without slicing up your face.
  63. I had a previous model of this shaver, and loved it. A former College roommate of mine stole it while moving out, and I never got around to replacing it until recently.<br /><br />I love it because it lets me keep a short stubble. Shaves well without pulling hairs. The vacuum works well to keep a hefty majority of the hair out of the sink. I do wish that the chamber for the cut hairs was removeable for easy dumping, but whatever. The battery is pretty long-lasting.<br /><br />5/5 stars, as it does what it's intended to do.
  64. Pros -- 1) Compact, lightweight, multi-voltage/frequency travel charger 2) Informative digital display with battery charge and length indicators. Cons -- 1) Useless for thick, hard beard hairs: a) The tines on top of the comb are too soft. If I don't apply pressure, the trimmer just glides on top of my beard, not cutting anything; if I do apply pressure, the tines warp and I get an uneven trim. b) The vacuum captures only 70% of my trimmings. Cleaning up the other 30% takes only a little bit less time than cleaning up 100%. 2) The tines on the front of the comb are short in order to leave an opening for the vacuum. Unfortunately, this means I cannot use them as a guide while trimming. This also means that I cannot easily trim my upper lip, since my nose blocks the front edge of the guide. 3) The cutting head is much too wide for my average-sized face. 4) With the comb removed, the cutting head still cannot provide a close shave, leaving at least 1mm. This means I cannot use the trimmer to clean up around my neck. 5) No flip-up detail/moustache trimmer. Combined with #2, my moustache goes unkempt. Verdict -- Will try to return this abomination, either to Amazon or to Norelco. Sticking with my Remington MB 300, with which I have no complaints but for the lack of a multi-voltage charger.

  77. Based on the large number of negative reviews on here, I called Philips to see if they would be willing to send me the comb that \\"doesn't\\" cut or jab you. The first lady I talked to was awful - she was horribly difficult and said they couldn't send one based on \\"one\\" review and just because I asked. I called back and spoke to somebody else and they were totally nice and able to take care of it for me. This is an obvious design flaw with this supposedly top model product - the next model down, that comes with the other comb, gets completely great reviews. It was certainly an oversight on Norelco's part, and they should certainly be happy and willing to ship out the replacement comb for customers who ask for it.
  78. The seller was great. I bought this for my boyfriend for Christmas and it got here on time, i was very pleased. He loves the product, he never gets nicks, the settings are very convenient and the little vacuum keeps the counter clean! Definitely recommend this product and this seller.
  79. I was very skeptical to purchase this beard trimmer because of the reviews regarding the guide comb. The negative comments were frequent and it seemed some people had luck procuring the contour guide from Norelco and a few said they got the right one. I want to report that I received mine yesterday and it came with BOTH guides. The contour one was great & vacuum gets close to 90% of the trimmings. So if anyone is on the fence like I was b/c of the guide comb, hopefully getting both helps your decision.<br /><br />The travel lock is also great as well as the turbo feature. It also charged very quickly and never lost power in the 20 minutes I needed to trim up the beard.
  80. Shaves close - no pulling. Really like the ability to adjust the cutting length - price through Amazon was great- you need to look around the web when ordering - really makes a difference.
  81. Paid for itself 10 times over on weekly hair trimmings. Will cover whole head on 1 charge or whole body ymmv. When done in the shower (water off), makes for ridiculously easy cleanup, bonus points if you can reach the can without getting out. DO NOT ABUSE THE DOOR LATCH, USE JUST ENOUGH PUSH TO RELEASE THE DOOR.<br /><br />Keep in mind:<br />-cant go from 10cm to 2mm in one go, have to trim in 2mm drops to keep vacuum from clogging<br />-no way to do tight spots like ear-head joint, use a $15 trimmer there<br />-no real 0 setting, have to use a razor to trim non-hair zones
  82. Seriously why is everyone complaining that the product doesn't come with the contour following comb... I was really hesitant to buy this because everyone said it doesn't come with the comb, so I ordered the extra part from Phillips Norelco before buying the product and it turned out the trimmer came with the contour following comb and the regular comb so now I have 2 contour following combs.
  83. Works as stated.The only complaint I have is that is is kind of hard to do detailed lines like the edges of my Goat-T.Its just a little hard to see the blades at the angle the are made.That being said,everything else works well.The vacume feature is great and the blades cut well,even on thick beard,as long as you dont let the hair catcher get overfilled.
  84. I used my Norelco electric trimmer for 10 years before it finally bit the big one and I decided to look for one that was very similar. Well, this was it and it is incredibly lightweight but sturdy enough! The settings are just right, offering many length options and it is a plus to have a vacuum function so hair doesn't go everywhere although, it vacuum doesn't do that great of a job sucking in the cut hair. It gathers about 60% of it, which is still nice. I don't like the way the door opens to empty the vacuumed up hair though but that's only minor. I wish that it was like my old one, where the container popped all the way out, but all in an all, it's a great trimmer and especially for the price!
  85. I've been using the trimmer for almost a month already and think it's great. The trimmer is easy to use and cuts precisely with its multiple adjustments. The vacuum feature captures the cut hair so there is no clean up. I would recommend to others.
  86. The Philips Norelco QT4070 is the greatest trimmer I have ever used. The clever vacuum system keeps the hairs from ending up all over the place so you can use it wherever you happen to be. I find it much more comfortable not to shave too close and this is the one for me. Easy to adjust and very quick charging make this #1 in my book.
  87. I used a conair before this. The stubble look took at least 5 minutes of work because the cut would be uneven. Now, it takes me under a minute and nowhere close to how messy my old system was. The price might force you to look the other way but I really think it is worth it.
  88. It is indeed a good machine: effective, efficient and quick. The only problem is the battery life which, in comparison to other major Philips products, is surprisingly short. The quality of trimming though is reasonable and effective.
  89. I've had this for a couple of months now, and so far it's worked very well for me. Mine came with both combs, so switching from the stubble comb to the contour-following one was not a problem.<br /><br />The vacuum works much better than the old Wahl model this replaced, which is a relief since there are so few vacuum-equipped models available. Nothing is going to get 100% of the hairs, but this one does really well.<br /><br />Knowing of the many stories of the little hair-compartment door breaking, I'm being very careful when opening and closing that, and so far so good.<br /><br />I don't really see the point of \\"turbo\\" mode, but having it there doesn't hurt anything. Also, as some have mentioned, it's not much good as a mustache trimmer, as the cutting head is quite wide, but it works well enough for my purposes.<br /><br />The battery seems to last forever on a charge, and then recharges in no time, so nothing to complain about there.<br /><br />All in all, this is keeping my old grey beard in good shape with very little effort.
  90. I've been using this razor for a few months now and it really works well. I was a little wary of the vacuum as I thought it might be a gimmick, but in the end I've been really happy with my purchase.<br /><br />First, the vacuum works surprisingly well. It's not perfect, but it gets the vast majority of the hair (a lot better than my last razor without one that threw hair all over the sink and counter). It also keeps the little hair there is relatively in the sink so it's an easy clean up. There are two levels of vacuum and I always use the higher level as I don't see any reason not to and it really works well.<br /><br />A lot of people before were complaining about the comb that came with the razor - the stubble comb. Though after a while people started reporting that it now comes with both the stubble comb and the contour comb. I did in fact get both combs. I use the stubble comb and I find it works very nicely. Some people complain that it bends or that there is a gap where you could cut yourself. First, the razor is good enough that you don't have to press hard at all to cut so there is no need to bend the comb. Second, I do see how you could cut yourself, as I almost did one day (got a pinch on the lip), but again I was in a rush and wasn't paying attention and got my lip right in between the comb and the razor at a bad angle. From now on I'll be more careful. I have also used the contour comb and it works well but I don't use it as much as I keep close stubble and the stubble comb works just fine. Some people complain that the length of the comb varies on the contour comb but this isn't the case as the shortest length of the comb (from the razor to the tips of the comb) is constant.<br /><br />My only complaint would be that it's a bit difficult to get up under the nose. As I keep short stubble, it's particularly hard. It's possible but takes a bit of work to get the blades close right under the nose. The rest of the mustache is no problem.<br /><br />Overall, I'm really happy with the razor. I don't have a beard and just keep stubble and I find this razor is perfect for that. There are many nice features - from it telling you the length, long battery life, travel lock, &c. It's a really fast razor and easy clean up so shaving can be done while I wait for the shower to heat up.
  91. Works great. The only downside I have come across is the door to empty shavings didn't close tightly. Then shortly after the plastic piece that held it close broke off. Now it just kind of stays almost closed until I empty it. Please, redesign the closing mechanism.
  92. I'm a goatee man and was looking for something to keep it trim while also being able to pull off that 5 o'clock shadow look by putting a close trim across the rest of my face. I had used cheap trimmers and some of those interchangeable numbers (does anybody ever really use the nose trimmer adapter?) and wanted to step up my game a bit. In this regard, this trimmer has been wonderful. My only complaint has been with the vacuum feature It sits above the blades and doesn't police all of the trimmings. If you're hoping to have a mess-free trim, it doesn't quite cut it (sorry, bad pun). I also find that the location of the vacuum makes it harder to judge where the blades are when trying to get in close around my goatee and sideburns. These complaints are minor, though, and I still consider this to be one of the best trimmers I've ever owned.<br /><br />Pros:<br /> - Strong trimmer (doesn't bog down through my thicker facial hair)<br /> - Adjustable length with digital display make to find and maintain a consistent trim<br /> - Holds a charge for a long time and a digital display of battery life has an indicator for low charge<br /> - 1/32 in trim gives a great 5 o'clock shadow look<br /><br />Cons:<br /> - Vacuum gets in the way and doesn't help much<br /> - Tends to discharge while traveling (not sure if it's kicking on or if it's something else but I've had bad luck)

  101. Better than the older model I replaced
  102. Norelco's beard and stubble trimmer is clean. This maintenance free trimmer includes a vacuum system that captures cut hair, keeping the mess off the bathroom counter and in the sink. For that reason, both my wife, and I, like it.<br /><br />With the attachments, it cuts from 1/32 inch to 23/32 inch, making it easy to keep your beard trim, or to maintain that 5 o'clock shadow look. There are 18 secured length settings.<br /><br />Turbo power boost increases the cutting and fan speed, and it contains a powerful lithium-ion battery, giving it a long life. It can be used with or without the cord. It also features a travel lock so that it won't accidently get turned on when you're traveling.<br /><br />The razor comes with a two year warranty. This razor is the perfect indulgence for the man who wants a quick-charging mustache/beard/stubble trimmer.
  103. Compared to any other trimmer on the market, I venture to say this is the most superior. I have owned at least 4 different types, including another Norelco. By any comparison, this product exceeds my expectations and makes other trimmers look like garbage.<br /><br />The trimmer is a pleasure to hold and seems ergonomically designed. The build quality is very solid- to the point of impressive. Adjusting the trimmer is accomplished via a rubber coated adjustment wheel that is accessible on both sides of the trimmer. There are length indicators on the side vertically (a scale in inches) and the adjustment size displays on the LCD screen in millimeters. This provides a precise cut to those who require such precision (not me). The width of the blade area is more than sufficient for face and other areas (more on that later). Touted as a Vacuum trimmer, it does a pretty good job overall with some room for improvement as it may not vacuum all hair although that may depend on the length of hair being cut. Hair collects in a little compartment with a swing door. The trimmer is rechargeable (a stand is not included however- just the charger). Despite being rechargeable, the trimmer is very powerful, easily cutting through thick beard.<br /><br />Some Issues<br /><br />As stated before, the vacuum does a decent job, but not a great job at collecting hair. The shorter the hair, the better the job. At the very least, it seems to significantly contain the mess. Another issue is that due to the design of the blade guard, you cannot really trim right up under the nose. It gets pretty close, but not quite. Finally, neither a beard brush, travel case, or recharger stand are included. I was a little surprised in this regard.<br /><br />I am unable to comment at this time on how long the battery will last. I will have to edit my review after a few months to see how the charge stands up.
  104. My husband promptly \\"handed down\\" his old beard and mustache trimmer when I gave him this one. He says it trims everything better than his old one and he loves the vacuum feature on this unit. The vacuum provides terrific ease of use and keeps everything neat and tidy. The compartment is easy to empty. The trimmer is easy to adjust with length measurements listed in both mm and increments of an inch as well as an LED number setting. The unit charges easily and quickly. Great product!
  105. My husband has a beard longer than the maximum trim length of this shaver, but, since he does cut his sideburns and shave his neck (or, rather, lets me do so), and since his 20-year old Norelco is getting very tired, I figured this was a good tool to try out for the job. The shaver is very clean and sleek - it fits comfortably in the hand, has a cord that attaches to its bottom, not someplace inconvenient like a side (you can use it plugged in or not), and the controls are intuitive. My only objection to its form-factor is that the thing is LOUD. This is not so much because of the blades, however, as because of the powerful vacuum that sucks the hair into the cutting blade. To change the cut depth, you rotate a thumb-friendly control that both physically raises and lowers the removable guard, and also lights up a large and easy-to-see LED readout that gives the depth in millimeters. (If it's possible to change that to inches I never figured out how). The current depth setting is also indicated by two small rulers on the sides of the guard - right side metric, left side inches. For some bizarre reason the setting between 3/8 inch and 5/8 inch is \\"15/32\\", not 4/8, and the longest depth is 23/32, not 6/8. I assume some engineer translated the millimeters into the closest inch measurement, and didn't think about tolerances and usability. I found that for very short whisker lengths this worked very well - it took off the hairs cleanly and quickly, with just a couple of strokes (I had to play with the orientation a bit - you need to stroke with the closed part of the guard forward, not the open side, or you'll get choppy results). For longer lengths (taking sideburns from two inches to 23/32) I had to start off with a scissors and then use the shaver to even things out, which wasn't worth it. The shaver also ignored hubby's mustache completely, even on turbo, but the hair there is very stiff and lies flat, so it wasn't cooperative about being sucked into the guard. I finally took the guard off and used the shaver freehand. I found the shaver to be quite easy to clean, using the included cleaning brush (I wish there was a way to attach this to the powercord, like a chuck key with a drill). For short neat beards that get shaved regularly this is recommended. For longer ones that get trimmed once a month or so it's a bit pricey, but still useful.
  106. I've always been skeptical of gimmicky products, so I was a bit nervous when I bought this. Needless to say, I've been impressed. It actually does what it says, which is rare these days it seems. The accuracy of the different settings is quite good. I was able to get an extremely close to the skin stubble with this at its closest setting. The vacuum works surprisingly well. It picks up virtually all the cut hair, and the tiny amounts it doesn't get is pretty trivial. It's a vast improvement over what I'm used to dealing with; it'll be hard to go back to a non-vacuum product after this. The only thing is you might have to clean it out in the middle of the shave, depending on how much hair you are trimming; but all it takes to clean it is popping it open and giving a few hard blows into the chamber. It takes about 5-10 seconds to do.
  107. Bought this as gift for my husband. He loves it!
  108. The trimmer seems to be well made, and will probably last quite a while. And I haven´t had to charge it yet, so that side is ok.   114. All around, this is a pretty good trimmer. I'm not unhappy with it. But it is not quite as advertised: 1) Unless your mustache grows nowhere near your nose, you're going to have a difficult time getting the trimming blades to the top of your mustache. The guard gets in the way, and even without the guard, the cutting head is not designed to get in that area easily. 2) This is messy--I call b.s. on the \\"without leaving a mess in the sink\\" line. It's much cleaner than other trimmers, but it's just impossible for a battery-operated, tiny vacuum system to catch all the hairs. You will still have to clean out your sink afterward. Other than that, the dial-operated hair-length control is nice; it's easy to clean out the hair collection chamber; and it keeps a charge for a long time.

  127. This trimmer is excellent. The vacuum feature works so well. I can't stress that enough. The LED display is just magnificent and the turn-dial works perfect.   128. Definitely be cautious when reading the negative reviews about the trim guide on this trimmer. It is different, but if you slide the guide along your face instead of trying to stuff your chin into the blade slot, you will have a much more comfortable experience. This trimmer is a little different from the previous model(980 I think), which by the way I loved until the day it found it's way into my toilet...still ran it just was never the same! The QT4070 has a strong motor, a more durable cover for the clippings catcher, and the digital display for battery and height is awesome. Plus the lack of springs and hinges on the guide will make this trimmer survive my poor luggage packing as well! Mustn't forget the travel lock! A great addition to keep the trimmer from draining itself en route to your destination. I have a pretty tough beard and this little guy made short work of it, neat as a pin! All in all I think if you can adapt your trimming stroke to the new guide you will be very happy with this trimmer...oh and don't try to drown it!

  133. I very rarely write reviews; but the Philips Norelco Qt4070 Turbo Vacuum Beard, Stubble and Moustach Trimmer Pro, Black/silver is certainly a PRO which needed reviewing. I bought a Wahl as a back up in case the Phillips did not live up to my expectations. All I can say is that the Wahl is now being gifted to someone. The Phillips Norelco turned out to be close to perfect. I can honestly say I have never had a groomer that worked so perfect. Each hair the same length. Now, there are flaws; but the flaws lay in the directions included with the product (or rather not included). Also, many reviewers before me seem to be selective readers. 1. The product does what it is suppose to do with no flaws. However, you can make it have flaws through usage. This goes with any product. 2. Yes, the guard can poke your lips as the tips are pointed (as posted by a reviewer). But, only if a person decides to use force/pressure. For example; you can have a needle to your skin and not feel it, but put force/pressure and you will. It is the same with the pointed guard (the guard is not sharp as a needle - I was just giving an example). It is designed not for use with force/pressure, instead let the machine glide and do the work. 3. For me the Philips Norelco Qt4070 is designed to do the work, by placing no force/pressure on the machine. I simply glide the Philips Norelco Qt4070 over my beard. The guard comb is flexible. It is designed to adapt to the chin area and curves on a face. Again, if you put force you will (IMO) have problems. Basically, if you choose a hair level and put force, the hair will be shorter than the level chosen. If you place no force, the hair will be the level you choose. 4. For those of us who have facial hair since we could grow it; we know that hair does not grow in one direction. It grows in many directions. So sometimes to get every hair the right length you need to find the angle/s that is/are right for you. For me, I find using themachine with the hair grain as oppose to against the hair grain works amazing. If I go against is is too short (for me). 5. The vacuum cleaning door does not close as securely as I would like it to close. It has open from time to time. But, a little tape in the corner helps. 6. Do not expect to find a product that does all you expect when it comes to facial grooming. No product will meet all your expectations. But, the Philips Norelco Qt4070 Turbo Vacuum Beard, sure does come close.
  134. Very pleased with this so far. Battery life is holding and the vacuum does help clean up. It is a little louder than previous models than inhale used but that was expected with the vacuum.
  135. Not bad - but not the best. I had never had a trimmer with a vacuum - and now having it for a couple of week - I really do not need. The vacuum works well during a traditional position, but when using it to keep a close cut on your head - the intake obviously gets clogged. No fault of the trimmer, but I should have thought this through before purchasing. I had an old Philips Norelco beard trimmer and it was perfect, being 8 years old, it was time to let it rest. I should have bought an actual head trimmer, something I am likely to do later after my tax return. Again, for traditional beard and mustache - it does work as described!

  140. This trimmer doesn't work well. The problem is that this thing doesn't trim evenly, and you end up looking like a clown. Let alone that the prongs on the comb bend easily...the bigger problem is that the comb's prongs don't actually cover the blades. It's designed that way so that the little built-in vaccuum cleaner can easily suck up the hairs. Unfortunately, it compromises the results on your face. Even when I very carefully try to hold the trimmer in a consistent manner across my beard, I end up with a very uneven trim. And it ends up looking ridiculous, which means I have to re-trim all over again at a shorter length than I wanted. I bought this trimmer because I liked the fact that it had 18 different length settings. And it's an all-in-one device. It doesn't have a million combs. You just adjust the length with a nob, and presto. Just like my old trimmer. You don't lose any pieces, because it's just one piece, and it's super convenient for traveling. But it does a horrible job at trimming. I don't need the stupid vaccum-function, which compromises the results on your face. I regret having bought this.

  148. I purchased this after I dropped my T980/60 and broke the guide. The QT4070/41 comes with two guards, one has an opening that's kinda sharp, and one that's closed and smooth. It's rather flimsy. Mine broke shortly after I got it. Now I have to use tape to keep the door closed. There doesn't seem to be any way to fix or replace the door itself.
  149. This trimmer is a very modern, sleek looking device with a digital readout of the guide height in millimeters (and analog scales on opposite sides of the guide that indicate guide height in both mm and inches).<br /><br />The removable guide is a very nice feature, as it can be easily removed by pulling straight off of the trimmer from any height setting, and when placed back on the trimmer, is still at the last height you dialed in. Very well implemented.<br /><br />The vacuum mostly works - if you're trimming over a sink, you'll still see some hair trimmings in the bowl, but far, far less than if you use a trimmer without a vacuum. Opening the door in the front of the trimmer allows a puffy little hairball to fall right out, without spreading trimmings all over the vanity.<br /><br />At first, I thought the two buttons controlled the trimmer and the vacuum features, respectively, but upon closer inspection of the manual, it appears that one is a power button (activating both trimmer and vacuum), and the other is a \\"turbo\\" button, increasing the power to both the trimmer and the vacuum. Like anyone presented with the option, I went straight for turbo mode and never looked back, and so far haven't seen any diminution of indicated battery power after half a dozen uses.<br /><br />According to the manual, you can use the trimmer when plugged in, even if the battery is dead, so you don't have to wait for it to charge if you've drained the battery and you need a trim in a hurry - it will suspend battery charging while you use it off of AC power.<br /><br />The included double-ended cleaning brush seems suited for the task of brushing out the screen in the vacuum debris chamber, but also looks as though it will be easy to lose. It would have been nice if there were some way of integrating it into the trimmer; but there isn't.
  150. I've always been a fan of Norelco elctric razors since the early 80's, so I had high hopes for the Philips Norelco Qt4070/41 Turbo Vacuum Beard, Stubble and Moustach Trimmer Pro. My hopes were not given over to disappointment, and I was met with a product that not only met, but exceeded my expectations. This trimmer can be used either corded or cordless, and for me, even on it's normal setting, it does a fantastic job trimming hair, and keeping any trimmings cleany vacuumed into it unit's storage compartment. I simply do not need turbo mode, though I admit I am not a person with thick or coarse hair growth. I can see Turbo mode being a handy feature for the hairier mammals of our species, however. Battery charge life is long, and charge time is relatively short, around an hour from a dead battery to full charge, and numerous trimmings between charges. The LCD display shows battery level, as well as trim length setting, and there are length index marks along the side of the trimmer as well, a nice feature if the LCD ever goes on the fritz. The size is easy to grip, not too small to feel awkward, and not to large to feel clumsy. In fact, it is a nice size to trim and neaten bearded areas other than the face, for those who are so inclined, without worry of clipper heads pinching any skin, they are well designed and simply do their job without risking any minor blood loss from the dreaded clipper bite other trimmers can give. While there is no mention of this practice in the accompanying literature, nor does Philips Norelco endorse or mention such use of this trimmer for that anywhere on their website that I can find, it is still a very capable tool that I have found fit for the job. I was also surprised at how quiet and relatively minor the the vibration was of this trimmer, given how powerful and effective this little trimmer is. The trimmer comes with a little brush to clean it up with when you are finished using it, and for those who travel, there is a travel-lock that prevents the unit from accidently being bumped on during travel. Simply hold down the power button for a few seconds to lock and unlock this feature. Overall a very rugged and well thought out device, worthy of anyones grooming arsenal.
  151. This trimmer is very good looking, comfortable to hold and holds a charge for a really long time. It even has a vacuum that sucks up most of the hair. I would have given it 5 stars but since it doesn't suck up all of the hair, I feel it could be slightly improved. I do like the fact that I use it to trim my beard ( I got with a 2 mm for sexy stubble) twice each week and I only have to charge it about once every 2 months or so.<br /><br />I recommended this to a friend who also purchased one and is happy with it. I think for the price, you wont find a better trimmer.

I found no problem as long as you are careful with the vacuum door and try not to force it open. It opens easy with just a finger nail to open the door. I find the QT4070 a luxury, and high-end trimmer, and ideally delivers for the additional price. I receive a smoother and even cut, with a cleaner sink and counter. Charging the battery is quick and keeping its battery charge longer than most is appreciated. I would highly recommend this product to anyone looking for a fantastic stubble and beard trimmer from a well respected name in this category.

  162. Philips Norelco has hit a homerun with this model! At first I was leery about some of the reviews of this trimmer. I had the previous model of this trimmer and this new model definitely addressed the deficiencies. This is the best trimmer I have ever had. I use it daily to trim my head hair. I no longer need clippers! The new comb head on this trimmer is fantastic. I use it daily instead of normal combing and forego the 1 to 2 week haircut I would otherwise need. The device locking mechanism is unique and effective. The larger display is very welcome. And the new adjustment ring is much less prone to inadvertent change of trimmer comb head setting. It has a low noise output (comforting). Battery power lasts between 1 to 2 weeks without needing recharge, even with daily use. The key to this trimmer is to use it daily. Then the trimmings are more easily picked up by the moderate suction. The suction is adequate if the trimmings are not too large. The cutting action is excellent and precise. Back in the 1950's my dad had a wire comb contraption with razor blades in it. He used it to groom my brother and I. Ouch!!! It pulled and hurt quite a bit and produced uneven results even though the razor settings were adjustable. The idea was novel; but the technology was woefully deficient. Norelco's QT4070 has changed all that. The technology has arrived! No more pulling! And it has precision grooming! However, nothing is perfect. The only detractor is the missing trim head for fine detail work that the previous trimmer had. I use that trim head on the QT4070 also, because it does fit. But, the trimmer shuts off if you try to use this fine trim head in Turbo mode. But, it works fine without being put into Turbo Mode. Norelco should provide that fine trim head. I see elsewhere in here that others note the same complaint. I have recouped the cost of this trimmer already by the haircuts I haven't needed. By the way, I have removed my beard and mustache. So, Ijust use this for haircuts now. I use Norelco's shaver for my face. Never a nick, no razor bumps, nice comfortable and clean shave. The QT4070 is well worth the purchase but the fine trim head should be included, especially for those that did not have the previous model. And, it would have been perfect if a carry case had been included. I believe that for the price, these two items should have been included. Philips Norelco missed the opportunity to be in the \\"untouchable\\" category as far as other competitors are concerned. However, I still rate them as the best of the best.

The trimmer guide and wheel are well built, and I like the overall sturdiness of the product. I LOVE that it works when plugged in—others don't do this, I don't understand it all; having previous trimmers die mid-shave results in some questionable last minute facial-hair style choices/compromises. :(<br /><br />There are two things I don't care for on this though. First: it's easy to &#34;override&#34; the guide lengths. You can go from, say, setting 3's length to setting 2's length with the wrong angle/pressure.   175. The neat part about the vacuum is that it pulls the hair away from your skin, which actually makes it easier to get a good shave on the first pass.<br /><br />After a few weeks of using this trimmer, I would recommend it to anyone looking for something easy to use and effective.   187. This is the first public review of a product I've ever purchased! Unfortunately I've been motivated by dissatisfaction! My Norelco T980 broke (or so I thought) and I bought this as a replacement. What a mistake! The vacuum isn't as good as the T980 but it still does an excellent job. The digital display that indicated the length to which it is cutting is nice - but what is astonishingly bad is the discomfort - no - pain experienced while using it! I tend to shave against the grain (which maybe is part of my problem) and I tend to be rough about it. This shaver hurts so badly that I had to return it and post this first ever review. The reason it is painful is because of the guard prongs that control the height of the shave. They come to a point that, when pressed against your flesh the wrong way - hurts! Also, I set it to cut a 5MM and often it actually drew blood while shaving. Now - say what you will about my shaving habits - but I've had two shavers before (a Panasonic and a Norelco T980) and they were both my pleasure compared to this one (and neither ever drew blood). In particular the Norelco T980 was so wonderful that the sharp contrast between it and this product are part of the reason I'm posting this review. I was so loyal to Norelco for the success of the T980 that I bought this product in an instant without thinking about it - what a mistake! I'm returning this product and - conveniently I have managed to revive my T980 - hopefully it will last until someone makes a decent vacuum based replacement that doesn't do more harm than good.
  188. My last three beard trimmers were Philips Norelco's in generations past of this model. I've been satisfied with all of them, and all failed simply because they wouldn't charge anymore. After extensive search of all brands and models available, I wanted to buy the previous discontinued model because it was smaller. I went with this one because the [[ASIN:B002C741MM Philips Norelco QT4021 Stubble Trimmer]] is selling for 4x the original cost due to demand! Terrible! :)<br /><br />I chose this shaver because:<br /><br />1 I travel a lot and this one has a travel lock<br />2. I need multiple adjustable guard settings and don't want to have to carry removable guards while traveling<br />3. The previous models have been good shavers and didn't have technical problems before the battery failed<br />4. While it wasn't exactly what I wanted, there didn't seem to be a better option<br /><br />While not a streamlined as some previous models, this model has several good features including:<br /><br />1. Charges very fast, less than an hour. The step down 4050 takes several hours<br />2. A travel lock<br />3. A clean accurate cut<br />4. Holds enough charge for me to use it for weeks at a time without recharging<br /><br />I'm not in love with this model compared to previous versions for a few reasons:<br /><br />1. The guard is larger and can't trim right under my nose in the mustache area as well as previous models.<br />2. The vacuum feature only catches 1/2 the hair, so I have a dirty sink plus a new bin to empty out. More cleaning work.<br />3. This model is larger at the top and takes up more space while traveling<br /><br />In summary, while this beard trimmer has some challenges, if you are a traveler who wants a shaver that doesn't have multiple parts to carry, this one is adequate, and while it has some annoyances it is the best option I could find. It will charge, trim and travel just fine though you may spend some extra time cleaning it.
  189. User: I like keeping a 0.5 to 1mm beard. For years I have had to time when I shave... not anymore. I now have that 'just shaved yesterday' look any time I need. Description: The device itself shows sign of sophistication and forethought. When you hold it, one can clearly see the length of the trim in millimeters and the remaining charge. (The lithium battery battery will last for about an hour in the event that your bathroom is devoid of outlets?) It has a turbo button which make both the cutting and the suction more vigorous, without compromising the quality of the cut. Finally, the vacuum works amazingly well. The sink is not perfectly clean - you may have to use one piece of toilet paper to retrieve the minuscule quantity of hair missed by the vacuum. The overwhelming majority of the clippings will be captured for simple disposal. (The efficacy of the vacuum system may be different for individuals who maintain beards longer than 1mm. I wouldn't know.) Some reviewers complain that it does not capture 100% of the clippings... I am amazed by the 99.8% that it does collect. Conclusion: I had trouble finding clippers that will do less than 1mm. This one will do 0.5mm and it will vacuum up the bits that would otherwise litter my sink/bathroom. (A feature I love.) It is the most civil way to create that crafted stubble look without shaving in advance. If you want a clean, reliable stubble trimmer, look no further. You will not regret this purchase.

Just set the length (I use 6-8mm) and run the trimmer down you beard or mustache and it trims it to that length perfectly.   195. [Edit] Product no longer holds a charge. Up until about week ago, a single charge would last for two to three weeks with me trimming stubble every 2-3 days. About two weeks ago after fully charging the trimmer, it only last about halfway through trimming before displaying an \\"E\\" symbol and cutting off repeatedly. I was able to get it to turn back on and finished my shave, and the unit display showed the battery as full except for when it was showing me the \\"E\\" symbol. Recharged the unit again a couple days later, overnight and fully, attempted to shave in the morning. The trimmer ran for maybe 3 seconds before telling me it was empty again, then going back to showing the battery as fully charged. I know how to charge rechargeable batteries to maximize life and did so in this case.<br /><br />Product failed after 7 months. DO NOT BUY.<br /><br />________________________________________________________________<br /><br />The trimmer seems well designed and catches, as another review says, about 90%-95% of the hair it trims. Mine shipped with two guards, neither of which could possibly be the basis for the negative reviews. I tried both of them and did not manage to injure myself or stab my lip. Either they have changed the guards that are provided with the trimmer, or some people are impressively adept at injuring themselves and will probably die soon from walking down the street, or something similarly hazardous. Because of some of the negative reviews, I was a little worried about ordering this product, but am quite happy.<br /><br />The only shortfall in the design is that I feel it doesn't trim quite close enough. The specs I saw said it would trim to less than 1mm, while each of the guards provided only go to a 1mm minimum. the second blade, that moves, is set back far enough that this likely affects the length as well, but I assume this is a safety measure so that I don't slice the skin off my face. Rather than shave, I simply trim my stubble and prefer it very, very short. I used to trim every two or three days, since cleanup with a normal trimmer is such a chore. While this trimmer doesn't cut as short as I'd like it to, I can trim every day not and not have to worry because the vacuum function works so well and prevents a mess.
  196. I had owned 2 of the previous version of this trimmer. It had some deficiencies, and I am happy to say that they fixed everything for this new model. They fixed the spring loaded comb problem. Before it was always coming unhinged. Now the hinge is gone. They added a new Li-iion battery, a new TINY auto-switching power adapter ( I travel a lot with it) and a digital read-out of the trim setting. I could never see the tiny number the previous model had. I was always grabbing my glasses so I could change the setting, but no more. They added a big bright digital display. The clippings now collect in a chamber with a hinged door. A big improvement over the old models removable receptacle. They fixed every complaint I had with the previous model. Bottom line is this one works even better. Well worth the price.
  197. The vacuum is a nice feature and greatly reduces cleanup. BUT The guard on this trimmer flexes toward the cutting blades with very minor pressure. I thought I would just need to be more delicate when shaving with it. However, after just a few shaves, it became obvious that I needed to press harder to lift some of the whiskers that lay flat. The guard would flex, and it would cut out a chunk of hair very short. So in the two weeks I've had this trimmer, I've had to completely shave my beard down to the minimum 1mm to avoid patchiness. It's totally useless in any length between 2 and 4mm, which is where I like to keep my beard. I've returned mine.

  202. Bought this trimmer to replace my old Norelco T-930 that would no longer hold a charge and I have not been sorry. This unit will stay charged no matter how long you leave it in the drawer thanks to Li-ion batteries, FINALLY. It has more length settings and cuts very well and the MM length display is much more useful then a dial with meaningless numbers on it. The vacuum is not great but works as good as my old one did. Two things that I did find disappointing is it does not come with a storage pouch or a narrow mustache trimmer head, luckily the narrow head from my old Norelco fits this one but most people do not have that option.
  203. I don't know if all of these beard trimmer company's just aren't testing their products, but I'm dumbfounded at how difficult it is to find a quality adjustable trimmer. This works fairly well, but has a major design flaw: the guard to adjust length isn't continuous, so the blade (at any guard length) can trim significantly shorter than you intended. If you don't keep the trimmer at a perfect angle to your beard, it's not hard at all to lop off a lot more than you intended. Tilting the trimmer up at all allows the blade to basically come in contact with your skin if you really pressed it, since there's a huge gap in the guard. Why the guard doesn't fully enclose the blade? I have no idea... I mean, who is designing these things?
  204. Norelco puts in a lot of bells and whistles on this one, but don't fall for it!<br /><br />The design flaw cited in other reviews makes for un-even trimming and a painful experience. The problem is basically a gap on the front side of the trimmer that doesn't keep the blade away from your face like it's supposed to.<br />Furthermore, the comb has very plasticy, flimsy feel to it.<br />The vacuum and the digital display are interesting, but I don't feel like they add much to the beard trimming. You end up paying a bunch of money for features that are essentially useless.<br />I have been buying Norelco beard trimmers for about 10 yrs and I usually am a fan, but this is the worst and most expensive trimmer I have ever bought.<br /><br />I ended up buying the Remington MB200 instead. The Remington model is about half the price and ten times better at trimming your beard.
  205. Great performance and variable settings....works great.
  206. I've choosen this model because of vacuum feature promising to collect cut hair instead of dropping them to sink.<br />Vacuum is very poor. It's collecting just few hairs. Sink is still hairy.

  209. I was a little skeptical before making my decision to purchase this trimmer. Initially, I was torn between this trimmer, the 4050, and the Braun Cruzer 6. I even researched the 4090 which is a product only sold in Europe and contemplated having it shipped to me. The reason why I considered the 4090 was because it does all the things the 4070 does PLUS it comes with a precision trimmer and a neat travel bag. The absence of a precision trimmer with the 4070 is the reason why I gave this product 4/5. In my opinion, a precision trimmer isn't too much to ask for considering the price and the issue with the contour comb (see Justin Yentile's review). Aside from this, it's still a great trimmer that gets all the hairs on my beard at a uniform length with barber-like results. I definitely do not regret purchasing the 4070!
  210. It seems difficult to find a good beard trimmer. This one certainly isn't it. After just a couple of months of very mild use, the latch on the trimmings collection chamber broke. Also the length guide seems to get in the way of getting close with the trimmer to certain areas such as my upper lip close to my nose. A charge seems to last a pretty good amount of time and the ease of adjusting for trimming lengths is nice, but the other shortcomings outweigh these nice features.
  211. I really like this trimmer. Somehow the little tab holding the trimming popped off, but I sure it's because I wasn't paying attention and hit it on something. My one gripe with this, and it's the same my friend has experienced, if you travel with it, even if you lock it, the battery always seems to die if when I take it on a plane. Make sure you carry the charger with you until you know if you have the same problem. Took me two trips to learn this the hard way.

You'll still have hair along the sink.<br />- After a few months the battery shows full charge. You go to use it the next am and it's completely dead.<br />PS.   214. I don't demand much from a trimmer. About once a week for the goatee, so I didn't need a professional clipper and don't use all that many accessories. This trimmer works just fine for my needs. The vacuum is silly, but it gets most of the hair. Battery life seems to be good. I've used it for three months with my original charge. This is the third Norelco I've owned in my life, and I've had facial hair since 1976. No complaints.
  215. I mainly wanted to comment on the saga of the missing Contour Follow Comb so thoroughly covered in other reviews of this item. I bought the item and called Phillips for a replacement before it even arrived. Then I waited with the unopened box for a week until I decided to risk opening it, and here the contour following comb was inside the box the whole time. I can't promise you'll get the proper comb in your box, but if you DO, it's a really nice shaver. I can't believe how short it will trim compared to my old trimmer. I used my old Panasonic trimmer at it's shortest setting and so far I've been afraid to go below 3 mm on this trimmer. It will go down to 1 mm! The vacuum does work. It catches about 80% of the hair. That isn't perfect, but it's a whole lot better than no vacuum. I consider myself lucky that the good come was in the box as I'm not very hopeful that the Contour Following Comb I ordered through Phillips customer service will ever actually arrive. It seems to be on infinite back order and recently looks like it was removed from Phillips' website completely. It's a risk, but you always return it unused (just be careful opening the box).
  216. This is my first Amazon review. I had to write after all of the helpful comments I received here. I just ordered the Phillips Norelco QT4070 and received it yesterday. It did NOT come with the contouring comb, so this seems to be an ongoing issue with this product. Thanks to reviewers here I had the number to call to get one sent to me. It was a no hassle phone call and within a couple of minutes I received an email order form and will be receiving it in 7 to 10 business days all free of charge. I gave it three stars for now because I havent used it yet and I had to go to the hassle of ordering another part. I'll probably bump it up to 4 if I really like it, but not 5 for having to order an extra part. When I update, I'll be sure and list the phone number to call but it is listed in several other reviews. i love Amazon reviews! They are so helpful in product selection!<br /><br />UPDATE: Ok this is going down to two stars. Its been two days and i noticed on my email that it said \\"OUT OF STOCK\\". I called them and it is on back order. The woman didn't tell me this when I called, so i assumed it was no longer on back order. Only because i carefully reviewed my email did i realize it was still out of stock. Well, judging from amazon reviewers its been on back order for several months now. I called them back and even though the woman said \\"7 to 10 days\\", they did confirm they had NO idea when it will be coming in from the factory. I had to get a supervisor. I asked them to send me another 4070 and they said there was no guarantee that it would have it. He initially wouldn't do it, and I had to argue since it was mistakenly advertised on their website as having a contour following comb that i should have that and not have to wait. It took a lot of arguing about it before he agreed, so beware, its not so easy as \\"an extra step\\". So now they are sending me a new 4070 and it may or may not have a contour comb. I\\"m hoping that since another amazon reviewer did the same thing and said there was no guarantee it would have the comb and it did have the comb, that this one will have the comb. I will update you when i receive it. If it doesn't have it, i'm going to have to call them again to have them send a contour comb. Another potential hassle. If it doesn't have it, and i have to call back, this product is going down to a 1 star!
  217. First let me say that I bought this trimmer in the hopes that it would replace an old battery operated Wahl product that I use to shave my head. I don't normally have enough time to shave regularly with a razor and shaving cream and I've gotten used to using on old Wahl Trim N Vac with the guard removed. However I also have a goatee and trim it weekly with an old Norelco that was rechargeable but losing the ability to hold the charge. I would have used the Wahl for this as well but I lost the guard and was replacing batteries frequently enough by just using it on my head. Which brings me to this Norelco - it has been a failure for both \\"shaving\\" my head and trimming my goatee. It doesn't go short enough with the guard off to give a close trim on my head and the \\"gap\\" in the guard seems to be a design fail. What is the purpose of having this gap?? If you use a low/close setting and you \\"tip\\" the trimmer at all you've gapped your hair with the gap in the guard!! I really don't understand. I guess I should have listened to all the reviews complaining about the gap. I won't use this anymore and have ordered a new rechargable Wahl trim n vac which should be in soon. Bald guys and close trimmers should be wary of this trimmer.

  221. The QT4070 is badly designed - the blades are exposed and could be in contact with the skin and thus produce cuts. I was told by both the person who answered the phone and by her supervisor that it is on back order. Given that without part #422203617711, this is a faulty product that puts the customer in danger of hurting himself, a responsible company should have taken this product off the market. In the absence of an appropriate and timely action by Norelco, I think that the US regulatory agencies need to intervene and ban this company from selling their products in the US.

  231. I have been through at least 5-6 trimmers trying to find one that worked correctly. The spring actuated guide is very comfortable. The turbo mode does actually provide improved performance when necessary (e.g. to eliminate multiple passes if you're in a hurry.)

When I opened the box I immediate noticed they included two combs, the open comb that allowed some of the nicks and cuts mentioned by other reviewers and the closed comb that resolves this issue.   261. This is my third Philips Norelco beard trimmer. All of them have worked well and I used them daily for years until the batteries started to lose their ability to hold a charge. As some have mentioned, the standard comb for this trimmer isn't great, but as mentioned in some other more recent reviews, mine in fact came with both. There was no need to call and ask for the second. The vacuum feature helps some, but there is still some stubble in the sink. It's definitely better than nothing though<br /><br />There were also a couple of nice additions since my last one which was several years old. The travel lock is helpful. I used to have to pack a charger when traveling in case the trimmer accidentally turned on in my luggage. I learned that the hard way once when I went to use it and the battery was drained. The digital screen showing the setting and more importantly the battery level is also nice. I don travel a good bit and this lets me know if I need to charge it before leaving. On my previous model I was always trying to remember how long it had been and guess how many trims I had left.<br /><br />The length setting also has a good solid feel to it. Two trimmers ago, I had to be very careful about what length it was on. If I wasn't paying attention, the guide would drop two lengths and I'd end up with a much shorter cut than I wanted. I never had the problem with the one this replaced, but the QT4070 goes one step further and has a nice solid click for your setting providing even more confidence that it isn't going to inadvertently slip on me.

  265. I received this yesterday and after using the Remington Titanium (POS) for the past 10 years let me just say this trimmer is AWESOME.   268. Over the last 8 months, when I had a full beard, a goatee, or now that trendy 5'oclock+ stubble this trimmer did the job on all perfectly. The fine adjustments fit whatever length you want. I don't understand the complaints about the guide, and haven't really had any issues. You just have to hold it at the right angle.<br /><br />Pros:<br />- Great fine adjustments for any length.<br />- Vacuum feature leaves very little mess and is easy to clean.<br />- Very Fast charging.<br />- Turbo mode will make short work of any kind of grooming.<br />- Can work from cord or battery should your battery be empty.<br /><br />Cons:<br />- Not waterproof. It would be great if it was wet/dry and/or I could clean/sanitize it under the water.<br />- Sometimes the battery, which seems to last a week or better even with the turbo on, just drops to zero all of a sudden. Don't know if this means something is wrong, if I actually just just that much power, or if the gauge is off. Fast charging, and because you can use it from cord and battery, make this not much of an issue.<br />- Electronic display of length settings sometimes is off from the actual setting, like it gets out of sync by 1 click. Going all the way down and then back up re-syncs the digital display with the actual setting. Not a big deal since the setting is clearly marked on the side and the digital display is more just for fanciness. It's also rare to happen, but it does.
  269. Great idea - no more wiping the hair trimmings from around the sink (well - not entirely true, because it does let some hair fly), but all in all a great idea......until you end up with great big holes in your beard! For some weird reason the designers created an adjustable guard where the cutting blades actually stick out of the guard! Yes - that big gap that you see on the picture means that the cutting blades can dig into your painstakingly grown beard in a flash, and you are left with the choice to trim it down (meaning a big change in your appearance) or hope nobody notices. My new (expensive) purchase has just been consigned to the bathroom sink closet, and I have retrieved my 5 year old worn out but trusty Remington. Don't waste your money simply because it looks futuristic and cool - sometimes the cheaper option is the better option.
  270. The Phillips Norelco Qt4070 Turbo Vacuum Beard Trimmer is a good product. It does an excellent job at keeping your beard with the perfect stubble look or nicely trimmed appearance. The vacuum does pick up most of the hair trimmings, however it does miss some and there still is a slight mess to clean up in the sink when finished. Despite the fault of the vacuum not being perfect, I would still recommend this product to anyone who is in the market for a beard and mustache trimmer.
  271. Excellent beard trimmer. Lots of settings. I love the travel lock feature so it doesn't accidentally get turned on and drain the battery during flight.
  272. the Norelco turbo is a very light, easy-to-use trimmer that does its job well. The easy-to-adjust (and remove when necessary) trimming guide is marked in inches and mm with nearly 20 different positions so you'll be able to maintain your beard at whatever length you prefer. It's easy to hold in the hand, narrow and light and maneuverable. The vacuum works well enough to collect the vast majority of clippings (I've yet to find one that gets them all), but it's a relatively small container so those with long or heavy beards might need to empty it frequently. The turbo power does seem to boost the power (it does get noisier) but I have no use for it so I can't say how effective it would be for those who might need the extra power. It's a pretty quiet clipper. It charges very quickly and holds its charge for sometime, enough for multiple uses over more than a week. It doesn't come with any guiding/molding tools as some trimmers do. I currently own a Braun that I'll probably keep using over this just because it does have the trimmer guides, but I certainly would have been satisfied with this had it been my only one. It's noticeably lighter than the braun which might be a plus for those whose trimming takes some time.
  273. bought this to replace my older turbo vacuum model....what a mistake! The space between the guard and the guide comb doesn't work for me at all...it jabs my skin and allows very very uneven cuts to happen. I tried my best to get adjusted but have just called norelco to exercise the 45 day money back offer.
  274. First off--like other critical reviewers you'll find here, I also had major problems with the comb. This review was almost a ONE-star rating, due to the sharp tines and general design of the comb. This _extremely_ poor comb design caused me to stab my lip several times and also resulted in uneven trimming.<br /><br />Like other reviewers, I previously owned a Norelco T980 and needed to move \\"up\\" when it would no longer hold a charge. With the T980 no longer available, it appeared that my options were either the QT4050 or the QT4070. Overall, the QT4050 is far inferior to the QT4070 in that it lacks the travel lock, quick charge, and turbo functions. HOWEVER...the 4050 has one feature that I believe was SUPPOSED TO BE included with the 4070--the \\"contour following comb\\". If you look closely at images of the two units side-by-side, you'll see that the comb design on the 4050 is closed--no giant gap and sharp tines with which to cut/stab yourself--and it also has a flexible guide. Those who previously used the T980 will surely recognize the design!<br /><br />In my frustration with the 4070's comb, I did some research. Philips Norelco CLEARLY markets the 4070 as using their \\"contour following comb\\". That's not actually true for what's \\"in the box\\", however. The comb that comes on the shaver is model number 422203617701, which is their \\"plastic stubble comb\\". As it turns out, the combs for the 4050 and the 4070 are _interchangeable_, and with a phone call to Philips, I was able to get them to provide the 4050's comb--model number 422203617711.<br /><br />After you get your shaver, if you're experiencing similar issues with the comb, call Philips at 800.243.3050 and ask to speak with a supervisor--first level reps can't seem to approve parts orders. Explain the situation, tell them you want the comb for the QT4050 (P/N 422203617711), and they'll send it to you, free of charge. Within a week, you'll be able to fully enjoy what Philips should have built in the first place!<br /><br />For the record--after I received my new CONTOUR FOLLOWING COMB, the QT4070 is a FIVE-star trimmer--it's exactly what I wanted. The one-star ding represents the hassle it took to get this product to be all it should be!<br /><br />For the record--after I received my new CONTOUR FOLLOWING COMB, the QT4070 is a FIVE-star trimmer--it's exactly what I wanted. The one-star ding represents the hassle it took to get this product to be all it should be!
  275. I recently purchased the Norelco QT4070, to replace a Whal trimmer that was a disappointing purchase. The norelco has been a great and I love it. I have a very coarse, unruly beard that grows in all directions and this trimmer does a great job contouring my beard using the attached guide. Then I remove the guide to trim errant hairs in the beard. The vacuum works great and gets about 90% of hairs.My only issue is that the battery is not replaceable, once the battery is gone the entire trimmer is done That said, I have not experienced any issues listed in earlier reviews. This trimmer exceeds my expectations.
