  504. no bad surprises and the charger work both on US and other countries so all good
  505. Works great. I would buy again.
  506. Review updated one year later, March 2015: After 1 year of weekly use, I downgrade this to 2 stars. Durability for a Norelco product is very poor. Within 3 months (about 12 uses), the catch of the clippings door broke and I needed to keep the door closed with tape. Now after 1 year the hinges email of the door is broken so the door is taped both sides. About 4 months into using the product I thought it wasn't holding a charge from week to week, which is strange because I use it maybe 10 minutes at a time and a charge should last 50 to 75 minutes of use. With trial and error I figured out that either there is a short or a loose connection triggered by disassembling the blade head to brush clean and or very mildly tapping to remove clippings. It doesn't happen every time but the only way to make it work again is to put it back on the charger for a full charging period. Original revieew March 2014: Four stars because it includes the contour-following comb, which is more comfortable than the fixed comb which is attached when it arrives packaged. This is a recommended trimmer if you like all the upgrade features. I paid for the upgrade features like 1-hour charging and two comb options, but now find I would have been OK with the features of the QT4050 because the 4050 has only the desirable contour-following comb but 8-hour charging. I'm going to keep this, but I wanted to let others know that if you don't need fast-charging, get the lower model, and more importantly, in terms of comfort, the contour-following comb is better than the fixed comb. I have had this trimmer one week, but see below I've been using an older Norelco with the preferred comb for years so I'm not new to the Norelco line. I needed to replace my Norelco G380 trimmer when I dropped it for the second time in a month and the comb length setting finally broke so I couldn't adjust to the length I keep my beard. The month before the spring mechanism of the contour-following comb broke and that made the comb less comfortable. I had the G380 several years and the Ni-Cd batteries weren't lasting very long, so a new trimmer was a must. I searched the reviews here on Amazon. What I really needed was a beard and mustache trimmer and that's what I focused on. Also, it was time to go Li-ion technology for the improved charging and duration. The G380 was a combo system, meaning it included a nose-hair trimming head (hurts), a big comb to trim hair (never used), a smaller head for sideburn trimming (worthless) and a tiny foil head for &#34;shaving&#34; (again, worthless). If all you need is a beard trimmer, avoid combo kits as they don't have good auxiliary tools. If you need one of those other tools, buy it separate. To summarize, this is a good trimmer. Comfort should be your first priority. The contour-following comb is the more comfortable comb to use; the &#34;fixed comb&#34; sometimes grabbed my beard while trimming. Lower-cost models like the QT4050 have the better comb (per Amazon description), with a slower charger, but would be worth the savings.
  507. Since deciding to stay with a close-trimmed beard three months ago, I thought an electric trimmer might help me keep it at desired length better than scissors. After reading through many Amazon reviews, the Philips Norelco QT4070 appeared to be the one to get. After a month or so of use, I not so sure. First, I thought that once I set trimmer for proper length, for me 5 mm., all I would have to do was run it over my beard and mustache in fashion similar to an electric shaver. Not nearly that simple. Getting most of hairs takes many passes from various angles and the bulkiness of the head makes trimming mustache awkward and only moderately successful. I still end up using scissors to get it trimmed to my satisfaction. While the vacuum does get much of hair, doesn't get it all, even when set to higher speed. Maybe this is typical of all such trimmers, or maybe I have to practice more, but I can't recommend it as a stand alone option to good old scissors!
  508. Pretty much the best Beard Trimmer you can buy. The Vacuum isn't perfect but gets up most of the hair, making clean up easier. And the LED display is a real plus especially for knowing when you need to charge it. I can be forgetful so I also like that it works while plugged in. Does great on general shaving, not so much on edging up however.
  509. Read a bunch of reviews, and went with these. Hands down the best trimmer I've owned. Highly recommended. Great battery life, easy clean up.
  510. Does everything I expected. Vacuum function not perfect but catches a good deal of hair.
  511. This is the second Norelco beard trimmer I purchased for my husband. He wore the first one out and specifically asked for the same brand again. Trims evenly and nicely. He hasn't said much about the collection of trimmings within the shaver, but I appreciate that I am not finding little bits of beard all over the sink in the morning!
  512. Such a great trimmer, I had a cheap one before and very happy I decided to spend some extra cash and get this trimmer which does not pull my hair at all, does not cut my skin and reduces the mass drastically with its vacum
  513. I got this for my boyfriend and he says he loves it. Best he's ever had.
  514. Seriously dont know why all the good reviews, this thing is so unbelievably loud and is no better than the 15.00 Wahl buzzer Ive had for ages accept that it vacuums up the hair which is really not that amazing of a feature because of how loud it is because of the suction. Spend money elsewhere.
  515. I'm using the trimmer without it's head (the shortest setting 0.5 mm) and it does a perfect job.<br />I used an older model before but it's battery died (don't remember the model but also norelco vacuum trimmer).<br />The vacuum option is very nice, although there is still some leftovers in the sink, it leaves much less mess than regular trimmers.<br />Charging takes less than an hour. I use it 5-7 times between charges.<br />Very pleased with the results, and it does a better job than my older trimmer.
  516. The head design is poor. It has sharp plastic fins that are only supported on the back side of the head. So as you shave, it easily stabs your face, or any other part of your body you may choose to shave. You have to be very careful ... no fast movements. The vacuum is nice, but not a necessity. The electronic readout to accurately set the millimeter hight for the shave ... was great ... until it broke. I much prefer the Panasonic ER224S. Easy to use, no stabbing, and works great around the body. I will be returning to it!
  517. I LIKED IT AND I GOT IT IN PERFECT TIMEING I COULDENT ASK FOR A BETTER SHAVER THANK YOU SO MUCH AGAIN!
  518. I know there are hair trimmers out there that offer every possible attachment, most of which end up in a plastic bag underneath the sink. This time Norelco concentrated on a specific goal instead of trying to be all things. It's a trimmer meant for guys who keep their facial hair close and neat.<br /><br />Charged the unit overnight back in January of this year, the day I bought it. Since then I've used it an average of three times a week. It is now the middle of August and the unit has finally blinked red. That's eight months of excellent performance on one charge. Unlike a lot of older designs, this machine didn't stall or slow down. It worked at speed until the end, then asked for more juice.<br /><br />I keep my beard and mustache close, never more than a quarter inch out. Once in a while I touch up the surrounding area. There's a turbo boost button for extra cutting power but I've never felt the need to use it. Clipped hairs are vacuumed into a small but efficient little holding area under the blade, and it's easy to dump out the hair and clean the hopper.<br /><br />There's no charger stand or wall mounting unit, and it doesn't stand on its own. I took the clear molded plastic packing shell out of the box and put it on my bathroom shelf above the sink. There the trimmer lies flat, waiting for a more dignified home. What would it have taken to design the bottom of the unit so it stands up straight? Only flaw in an otherwise great design.<br /><br />If you purchase this trimmer to keep your close beard and stubble looking pop-album ready--you'll be pleased with its performance, features, and especially the awesome battery life.
  519. I've tried several trimmers over the past few years. The last one was a Remington something or other that I bought at Walmart and it lasted all of 4-5 months. It's still working fine but I've never hated a trimmer like I hated that thing. I pulled my beard from day 1 right out of the box. I had to use it so gingerly to avoid ripping my facial hair out by the roots that shaving took forever and I always dreaded it. I finally had enough and purchased this jewel. I wish there was a half star because I really would have given it 4.5 stars out of 5.<br /><br />The Positives<br />* Digital readout of your trimmer length setting<br />* Digital indicator of battery life<br />* Built in vacuum to clean up MOST of your stubble<br />* Turbo mode to take care of business in quick order<br />* Super close \\"stubble\\" setting<br />* Absolutely no pulling even when rushing<br /><br />The Negatives<br />* There is still some sink cleanup after shaving but the vacuum did collect probably 95% of the trimmings<br />* The head is a bit bulky so it's tough to get into tight spaces like under your nose<br /><br />As you can see, the positives are far greater than the negatives. Worth the extra $15 bucks over the cheaper models in my opinion.
  520. I'm only reviewing this product for what I've experienced so far. Just got it in the mail and knew I was going to have to contact Phillips about a replacement part after reading some reviews. That seemed fine to me, because besides that, it sounds like a great product. I was on the phone for 20 minutes with customer service ( at least the lady was friendly) trying to figure out why I needed a replacement, and mixing up the part number. There were no managers around to authorize a replacement (called on a Saturday) so she's going to get back to me on Monday. Besides that fiasco, I was expecting some type of travel pouch to come with the trimmer, since on the Amazon product page, it clearly has pouch check marked as one of the features that comes with the 4070. Needless to say, there is no pouch that comes with it. When I mentioned this issue to customer service, she told me the pouch only comes with the 4090. Anyways, have not even used it yet, maybe it will be worth it in the end.

It shows it was to be with this unit so I called customer service - that was an experience. This unit is for stubble ONLY!!   522. I've had a beard for 10 years-- the majority of which i've used a panasonic beard trimmer which wasn't great but it did the job. When it died and I went to get a replacement, this Norelco was all I could find at my local Target store. The first time I used it, I knew it was the worst decision I could have made. This trimmer fails miserably at everything it was designed to do: 1) it does not cut evenly across your beard. My beard looks uneven and unkept compared to other trimmers I've used. (This is readily evidenced by pulling up hair at different spots in your beard and seeing completely different hair lengths). And yes I used it correctly, with multiple passes-- 2) the sharp plastic tines cause the most painful trim I've ever experienced 3) on 2 separate occasions, after setting the trimmer to level \\"7\\", the guard has moved right in the middle of trimming- causing a large bald strip in my beard. Now I have a mustache/goatee-- thanks alot, Norelco. 4) I recently noticed after a couple very, very short beard trims that what was setting \\"7\\" is now corresponding to setting \\"5\\"?? I noticed this when I set the trimmer to it's lowest setting before taking it on a trip and noticed that at setting \\"2\\" the trimmer was at the lowest it could go. So basically the guard height is no longer corresponding to the number setting... so you can't even keep track of how short your beard is going to be?! 4) while the vacuum in this trimmer does function, it frequently gets full/clogged. This will require you to turn off the trimmer and empty the hair trap numerous times during each trim. This has nearly tripled the time it takes me to trim (previous to the Norelco, I simply trimmed over the sink- problem solved) 5) This trimmer does not function when you attempt to use it upside down in an attempt to reach tight spots like the part of your mustache right underneath your nose. This results in the sloppiest mustache trim I've ever had the privilege of wearing.I end up having to use scissors to try and clean up the areas this trimmer cannot handle. In short-- if you don't particularly care for small details and/or your beard is very long- this trimmer may work out fine. But if you like a tighter beard with more detail, this trimmer cannot function at the most basic level.

When you try to apply the blade directly to the edge you want to trim, the vacuum intake gets in the way, so you have to tilt the razor nearly to horizontal to get the cutting blade to your skin. Once you do this, you can't see what you're doing, you can't see the blade and your hand and the body of the razor gets in the way. Plus at that point the angle is not good for cutting. So, I had to buy a second beard trimmer. I use this one, but basically it was a waste of money. It does save some time cleaning up cut hair, but to me, it's not worth it.

  549. I have many complaints about this trimmer: First, the comb head is cheaply made from soft, pliable plastic that bends, causing the trim to be uneven. Second, by a flaw in the design, far too much hair gets sucked into the removable trimmer head casing causing the trimmer to slow and, therefore, stop cutting hair or cut it poorly, causing split hairs. Third, I do not see any reason for it to have a \\"turbo button\\". According to Norelco, the turbo button creates \\"greater suction power and increased cutting speed\\", so shouldn't it just be turbo all the time? This just seems to be a gimmick you end up paying for. Fourth, at $44 it is severely overpriced. I also own the [[ASIN:B000FED5D0 Philips Norelco T780 Rechargeable Vacuum Trimmer]], and the comb head is much more solid yet flexible, although the trimmer is pretty weak, which is why I bought this other trimmer in the first place. If the Norelco brand or vacuum feature appeal to you, at $5 less, Norelco also makes the [[ASIN:B003U8K6M6 Philips Norelco Qt4050 Vacuum Beard, Stubble and Moustach Trimmer, Black]], which seems to be a good combination between the other two Norelco Vacuum beard trimmers, IF it has a powerful trimmer, because it does not have a turbo button. Also, any basic, corded trimmer will most likely outperform this trimmer. Fifth: After a year, it will NOT function at capacity when unplugged, and further, the turbo button doesn't work after a few minutes unplugged. When unplugged, an \\"E\\" shows up on the screen and it turns off immediately. Conclusion: Split hairs, an uneven trim, eventually stops working. Do not buy.
  550. Before buying this item last Christmas I read several online reviews. This trimmer seemed to be the best of all. The vacuum feature was especially intriguing to me. However when I got it I was disappointed. It has 3 design flaws, listed here in order of importance to me: 1. Vacuum is of little use For me, the purpose of the vacuum is to avoid having to wipe down my sink after trimming my beard. This does not accomplish that -- yes it reduces the amount of shavings that get on the sink. However it still loses enough that you have to wipe the sink down. Since it's just as easy to wipe down a sink with 50 stubbles as one with 500, the vacuum feature was useless for my needs. 2. Couldn't see exactly where I was trimming I also didn't like the angle of the head. While using it I was unable to see where the tip of the blades met my face -- so I was tapping a bit in the dark. I'd trim, move the trimmer to the side, trim some more, etc. To get a good trim, I need to see where I am trimming while I am trimming. 3. Comparatively poor battery life The battery life leaves a lot to be desired since I've had a trimmer with a lithium ion battery. After returning this model I purchased the [[ASIN:B001GQ3GEY Wahl Lithium Ion All In One Trimmer]] I have charged it only once since purchasing it, i.e. in the past 12 months! It came pre-charged, so count it as 2 charges, and it's still going. With such a better performance, I don't understand why _all_ trimmers and electric toothbrushes don't use lithium ion batteries. 4. Misleading product marketing Philips sells a nearly identical model (the [[ASIN:B003U8K6M6 Philips Norelco Qt4050 Vacuum Beard Trimmer]]) that \\"only\\" trims to \\"1/32\\" of an inch. The 4070 promises to trim to \\"1/64\\" of an inch. But then on the box you see that it accomplishes this by telling you to take the spacer guide off. So unless the spacer guide is non-removable on the QT4050, it should also go down to \\"1/64\\" of an inch. This kind of misleading marketing annoys me. I have been happy with the [[ASIN:B001GQ3GEY Wahl Lithium Ion All In One Trimmer]] since then, and don't cease to be impressed if not amazed by it's battery life.

  554. Let me start by saying that I have a thick full beard and my favorite shave gel (Zirh) recently went from $2.68/oz to $4.44/oz which is what prompted me to look for an electric shaver/trimmer. I heard about this product while listening to Howard Stern and thought I'll give it a shot. If you use this product with the guard on, then you will have the \\"gap\\" issue/problem that other reviewers have talked about on this site. I prefer the 5 o'clock shadow look so I use it without the guard all together and it comes out looking nice. You make ask yourself why I don't just use hair clippers but the other nice feature on this is the vaccum. While not perfect, it does well enough to keep from making a mess in my bathroom. And I find that if you use it often enough, the hairs are small enough to be caught by the vaccum and make no mess which means you can use it anywhere. I don't travel with it so I couldn't say much about the travel lock and I always keep it charges so can't say much about the battery life but the turbo option is nice for someone with a thick beard. Overall I recommend this trimmer.
  555. I have owned and liked older Norelco shavers. This is the first beard trimmer I've owned and this review is written after using it a few times. I bought it after reading a number of reviews on a number of different sites and came to the conclusion that it was one of the most highly recommended products in it price range. Overall I'm satisfied with the product, it does what I intended it to do; trim my beard evenly with minimal effort. I found it easy to use and clean. The vacuum feature is nice. It collects most but not all of the trimmings but I don't think that you should expect a battery powered device, never mind a corded device, to create enough suction to do that. It significantly reduces the mess that you would otherwise have if it didn't collect any trimmings. It is easy to take apart and clean. When re-attaching the beard comb one needs to carefully align the comb with the groves in the trimmer to get it to go on properly but this is only a minor quibble with the design. It appears to be fairly well constructed, time will tell about its durability.
  556. I purchased this to use as a body trimmer-I was looking for something to take my body hair to VERY short, but not quite a shave. For this, it is perfect. With the (fairly lame) comb removed it works with amazing speed. No hair, even the \\"body huggers\\" that you can't get to stand up, can escape it. Also, it doesn't much matter if you're stroking against the natural growth direction or not, if you can get the cutter on the hair, it's going to get trimmed. The unit is brand new and the blades are very sharp. In this condition, I was able to trim most of my body with only perhaps a third of a charge. I also found that it didn't make much difference how I held the unit against my skin. This made it easy to trim hard-to-reach areas. It cut all the hair and didn't \\"bite\\" my skin anywhere. Just be certain not to put a loose fold of skin into the cutters, it CAN cut the skin if you do. Overall, this does exactly what I was hoping for, quickly and well. The vacuum gets almost everything. The QT4070 is slimmer than the T980 and takes less space in the drawer. The AC unit is very compact too. I'll be getting the contour comb for longer trims, the supplied comb deserves the criticism it's getting. After a long wait (weeks) my contour comb arrived. I find it effective and very comfortable to use. After short consideration, I threw the supplied comb, in all it's lameness, away.

  566. I really like this beard trimmer. The vacuum sucks in all the cut hairs so it doesn't make a mess all over the sink. I'd been trying to hold a trash can under my chin while trimming with my old trimmer, and it was a mess and a pain! This eliminates all that problem.<br /><br />It cuts very well and the blades are sharp. Especially trimming without the guides on the neck or anywhere you want a clean spot, it does an exceptional job! The trimmer guide for the beard isn't as good as my old trimmer, though. It's a great deal stiffer and doesn't seem to flex enough to get down to the level it's supposed to to let the blade cut right. I seem to be going over the same spots quite a few times.<br /><br />I do really like the digital settings to be able to trim to the exactness of a single millimeter. I use a different setting for my main beard and for my mustache above my lip and on the sides of my mouth. This lets me get the setting exactly right to keep a nice, even trim that blends in nicely. It's a little loud on Turbo with the vacuum, but not too loud and not much louder than any other trimmer.<br /><br />One really nice thing is it only has two attachments - not the 10 or 12 things you have to keep track of. One guide for trimming beards; one guide for haircuts; a small cleaning brush; and the charger. It would have been nice to have a carrying case or pouch to go with it.<br /><br />All in all, this is well worth the money. Holds a charge for a long time and recharges quickly. It gives me a nice, even trim, blending different length cuts smoothly and precisely, and avoids the mess of whiskers falling all over the sink. I may buy another one before they quit making it!<br /><br />4 stars only because of the stiffness of the beard guide, but even that is something I can live with, and I hope it gets more flexible with use.
  567. I have been using it for couple years now for &#34;shaving&#34; (0 mm) head and face and trimming head (6mm).<br /><br />Vacuum Cleaner works great. Dramatically reduced amount of hair in the bathroom.<br />Fast charging time.<br />Doesn't shave as clean as some other trimmers - leaves about 1-1.5 mm. Nevertheless, going to by this same trimmer when mine will go down.
  568. I owned two of these. They work very well and do a great job of doing what they are supposed to do. However the lid for the compartment that collects the hair is very flimsy. The first one I owned after a couple of months it would not shut properly, so it would open up while shaving and hair would fall all over the place. I returned it (using credit card return I think it was like after 2.5 months) and got another hoping I just got a lemon. But same happened with the second one. I now use an elastic band to hold it down, not really ideal
  569. I just don't like this trimmer at all. The hair catcher doesn't work very well, so I end up cleaning up the hairs after every shave anyways, and the lengths are very inconsistent. The closeness of the cut entirely depends on the angle you hold the trimmer, I don't like that I want it to be uniform, the blade guard is supposed to protect you from trimming to much. I would either get the WAHL peanut or in fact, the cheaper version of this trimmer.

I now have an awkward routine of using this trimmer to cut 95% of my beard (it misses a lot even after multiple passes) and then finish it with my old trimmer. It is great at sucking hairs up, the only reason I use it to get the majority of my unwanted facial hair off my face.
  573. Love it. I use it to shave my head

  580. I've been using the trimmer for a couple of months. Well engineered, feels good in the hand, and most importantly, performs exactly as advertised. Best trimmer I've ever owned.
  581. This is a great trimmer for people like me who have thick beards and like to let them grow out then trim them back. This trimmer doesn't pull hair or cause tangles it even has a setting that increases the RPM's so that it will cut a lot easier through really thick hair. This trimmer is easy to clean, charge and store. It will work both on and off the charger so if your battery dies, you can plug it in and continue so that you dont have one side shaved and one side not.<br />One negative I have is that the plastic door on the front that holds the vaccumed hair will come open and doesnt have a good latch on it to stay closed. It worked well for the first couple months, but now it won't close.

  586. Its nice and it does an OK job. I've used other trimmers and not had this problem so I know its cause of the guard. I keep my stache and goat a little shorter that the average bearded dude so maybe that's the issue... I wouldn't buy it again, but I will use it and it is OK for what it is.
  587. I had the previous top end version of this trimmer and had it for many years before problems happened (mostly plastic part cracking/breaking). I was able to work around them (by using superglue) until the batteries wouldn't hold much of a charge. So I replaced it with this model despite the comments warning me about its shortcomings. Well, two months in and I'm not that impressed with the design or quality.<br /><br />The good: it provides a decent, consistent trim, charge lasts a long time, it charges quickly, good adjustment function/display, vacuum function works reasonably well.<br /><br />The bad:<br /> The trim guard - has too few comb tines that are sharp and poke you in the lip unless you are really careful when trimming your mustache, just feels hard and uncomfortable. I much prefer the guard on my previous model (and that is on the current Philips Norelco Qt4050 model).<br /> The vacuumed hair door latch is a tiny plastic tab that has already broken off. When the tab was there, the door was cumbersome to get open. I only use my trimmer 2-3 times a week, so it took less than 25 uses before it broke. The tends to stay shut without the latch, thankfully. I don't like the swinging door design as much as I like the \\"hair cup\\" that slide out of my last model that I could tap in the trashcan or the sink to empty. Tapping the whole trimmer on the trashcan/sink is more difficult.<br /> There at just too many sharp spots on this trimmer. When using it with the guard off, there are two sharp plastic points on the outside bottom edge of the trimming blade. It was not comfortable to use for precise trimming around the mouth and nose because it scratched/poked my lips and nostrils. I had to use a burly nail file to round of the sharp points to mostly alleviate this design flaw.<br /><br />I'd chose the Philips Norelco Qt4050 over this one knowing what I know now. **** EDIT (May 2012): I'd stick with the Qt4070 based on the fact the contour trim guide isnow included. See other edits below.<br /><br />edit: Today (3/14/12), I used Philips Norelco's customer service chat to order the contour trim guard which was not included with my trimmer. They are back ordered and was not given an ETA. They said they would send it via expedited shipping once it was in stock. When I bought this trimmer in October of 2011, it only shipped with the gray stubble guard. I later chatted with support about the broken tab on the vacuumed hair door and they are sending me a replacement trimmer since the door is not customer replaceable.<br /><br />edit (May 2012): I have received the new trimmer since the original trimmer's door broke and I have received an additional contour trim guard. The contour guard makes ALL the difference in the world in regards to comfort vs the standard trip guard. I am also impressed with the customer service/support for this product and how I was helped. I have changed my rating from 3 to 4 stars.

  601. With beards and stubble becoming popular again, after 30 some years of being clean shaven, I decided to give a beard a try and so I did some research to find the best beard trimmer. I've always liked Philips Norelco, and have used their electric shavers for years, but what made this unit really stand out to me was the built in vacuum that captured a lot of the cut hair. Upon trying it, I really like this unit and am happy with my purchase. The built in guard quickly slides up and down to adjust the length and it can go from a very close stubble to much longer. The battery life is fantastic, I think I charge it maybe once every 2 or 3 months at most. And the vacuum function really does capture a good deal of the clippings, making a lot of a mess to clean up in the sync. Some of the downsides is that the unit is a little bulky to get all the area on my upper lip (mustache) and that the door for the captured hair opens a little too easily.<br /><br />Pros:<br />Captured a lot of the hair so very little sink cleanup<br />Battery lasts a long time<br />No separate combs to loose, all in one unit.<br /><br />Cons:<br />A little wide so it's hard to get the upper lip area<br />The vacuum door opens too easily so can make a mess if you're not careful<br /><br />Overall, a good purchase and I would recommend.<br /><br />***Update 11/2014***<br />I've had the unit for over a year now, and the quality isn't a high as I'd like. I had one unit that stopped working altogether, but contacted Philips' customer service and got a replacement unit. It did take almost 4 weeks though. Also, on both the old and new unit, the door that held in the waste stubble kept breaking so that it wouldn't stay closed. I have to hold it in place which is annoying. I downgraded my review from 4 stars to 3.

  625. I've been looking for a stubble trimmer, and I was reluctant to buy this one after reading all of the reviews, but there really wasn't any other great option, so I finally just bit the bullet and ordered this one. Like other reviewers have mentioned, this did come with the extra contour guard that everyone says is a must. I must agree as well. I tried the first guard, and not only are the points on it sharper making it more uncomfortable, but there's a big opening in it making it much harder to get an even trim. I could put it on 4mm, and still shave down to the skin if I don't keep it at a perfect angle. There's a big gap in the guard that you could easily stick your chin all the way down into. Then I tried the contour guard, and it is a lot better. I got a much more even trim, and I think it helps do a better job of trapping the trimmings and getting them vacuumed up. I was hoping that when removing the guard that I could use it for a close shave on the detail work, but unfortunately it's not very good at that. Still, I'm happy since I'm replacing some corded hair trimmers that I was using.

I have no problem with the regular guard and have actually been using that one. The vacuum works good, although it's not like a professional one that's actually hooked up to a real vacuum.   632. I purchased this item on the basis of reviews which said the device is fine, the problem is that they omitted the contour comb, but you can obtain the missing part by calling the company. I planned to call the day I received the item to have them send me the missing part.<br /><br />Much to my surprise, when I opened the package I discovered that both attachments were included, just as the box and the enclosed paper manual says.   633. Overall, I cannot recommend this trimmer based on several design flaws I believe will be problematic for most users.<br /><br />The highlight of the QT4070 is probably its design \\"look and feel\\". Despite some reviews that disagreed on the vacuum effectiveness, I do feel it works very well. However, in so doing, it introduces an additional functional design flaw that reduces the quality of this model. It's difficult to shave a straight line, such as the sideburns. Since the vacuum opening is raised very close to the cutting blades (and is no longer a flexible shutter), it gets in the way of making straight line cuts. This is a critical issue that should be corrected for a trimmer at this price point. I would rather the vacuum feature work less effectively in order to have the trimmer work as expected - if a trade-off is required. Not being able to easily trim neat sideburns defeats the purpose.<br /><br />The device itself also feels lighter, and has the feeling of less durability compared with earlier models. The vacuum deposit area is now a door instead of a drawer. It's less effective and causes more messy cleanup. The door is awkward to open, and subject to breaking if you apply too much force. Likewise, the door is also a part of the storage volume, so when you open it up, shavings are likely to fall out and create a mess.<br /><br />The digital blue cutting depth and charging indicators look very nice; however, the rotary length selector lacks grip and is not smooth to turn, i.e. it feels cheaply made. This again, is a step backward from earlier models.<br /><br />My impression of this shaver is that the designers attempted to drastically lower the cost of materials, but compensated by making the product \\"look\\" better. I think they were successful in creating a lower quality product.<br /><br />Without the lithium battery, this seems like a product with a consumer retail value of $15-$20. If the older models were available, I would trade the QT4070 in an instant.<br /><br />This is a non-impressive re-design of a product that was previously fantastic. I really hope the Philips Norelco engineers \\"run\\" back to the drawing board, and ensure the next generation of this trimmer re-focuses on quality and effectiveness of its core features. Thumbs down.t.<br /><br />This is a non-impressive re-design of a product that was previously fantastic. I really hope the Philips Norelco engineers \\"run\\" back to the drawing board, and ensure the next generation of this trimmer re-focuses on quality and effectiveness of its core features. Thumbs down.
  634. The built-in vacuum make for a much cleaner and neater bathroom sink surface. The unit has a quality, solid feel. I found the width of the cutting edge a little wide making trimming of the mustache around the lips a little tricky. It also requires a little lighter touch over the skin than I am used to. It is very easy to adjust, and a series of blue lights monitors the battery status. I appreciate this last feature as you don't start the morning off with a unit that does not work. All in all I would recommend this trimmer.
  635. does the job, but not quite as effective of a vacuum as i would have hoped. catches probably 70%, which is better than 0%!<br /><br />it's also hard to line up to do a direct trim at the neckline because the guards block your view a bit - never had a problem with a full trimmer that had detachable guards.<br /><br />super easy to use though with the mm specific dial, and i trim my beard much more often because this device's variability can get the actual length i like.
  636. I have tried multiple shavers with guards to achieve stubble. This is the only one I have found that easily and effectively gives me an even 5 o'clock shadow.
  637. Husband uses it several times a week to keep that professorial look. Only complaint is the cheap door on the raiser keeps popping open. Have to keep it shut with a rubber band. You would think that they could make a small change to the design to fix that. But know about this flaw when I ordered it so was not surprised just annoyed. Still does an excellent job of cutting at various heights and it stays for weeks between charges.
  638. Great service and product worked as expected. Love the fact that it has a built-in vacuum to hold 99% of the hair.
  639. if you want to spend your money i would suggest to look somewhere else.<br />Maybe i got a defective unit and I should have asked for a replacement... or maybe the entire thing is planned to fall apart after one year.<br /><br />I bought the pro, the trimmer works pretty nicely but after exactly one year the problems started (and the warranty of course was expired).<br />I cannot use the turbo charger anymore, an &#34;E&#34; is displayed on the screen and the trimmer stops working completely; sometimes the same happens during normal use!<br />I don't think the vacuum system really ever worked, i always have to be careful where i trim (especially for the 0.5 stubble) because it makes a huge mess.<br />The &#34;door hinge/lock&#34; broke almost immediately and i have to hold it closed during the entire trim.<br /><br />A big thing for me since i constantly forget to charge it is that you cannot really use it while charging, the cable doesn't stay in place at all and you have to hold the connection if you want to use it while charging.<br /><br />Again the trimmer itself works nicely but all other problems are really annoying, i would use my money somewhere else.
  640. I got this shaver to keep a stubble on my face and it worked perfectly. It didn't make any mess all thanks to its' built in vacuum system which watched the hair in a little chamber. Aside from the stubble option, it has various length settings to get the desired shave that you are looking for. On top of that, it was affordable. I recommend this to anyone who wants to keep their stubble.
  641. Awesome quality but is still makes a little-bit of a mess. It prevents hair to be all over the place and it collects the majority but you will still get hair all over the place.
  642. I am very happy with the device. However quite disappointed that when the device arrived, I realised that I needed an adapter for the power cord to charge the device. This means that I now have to go and find an adapter, possibly buy a combination pack for the world and not just for this device. It would have been good to know beforehand that this was the case and I have been told by friends that when they received their electrical devices from overseas they got an adapter included in the quoted price. The company surely knew that I would need one posting it to Australia. Ummm!!!!
  643. It's good to replace my older trimmer with this one. Its smooth, good battery life, nice adjustments but the vacuum does not work as advertised. It collects only ~ 60 % of hairs and 40% scatters.

  645. i bought this for myself, and am glad i did. the razor works great and it keeps the stuble to itself unlike other one i had. the suction on the vacumn really works. holds charge good too!
  646. It is good, but not as expected, I mean it does not give me the option to do different bird styles, all what I can do is normal shaving, which sometimes sucks!
  647. Works as advertised but the power cord is stiff wire, not very flexible. Also while the digital display shows the length (in mm) that you have it set for, I've had one instance of the battery running down and the actual length setting and that displayed were incorrect when plugged back in. Fortunately the digital display showed shorter than the actual setting so if this is some kind of &#34;computer glitch&#34; you will not cut your beard to short. The settings can also be read on the side of the adapter so not much chance of screwing things up. All in all I like it and use it regularly and will keep it.
  648. Quality product and given the engineering I believe it was well worth the price. Philips Norelco products are well engineered and this one was very efficient and did a good job
  649. The vacuum fills up rapidly. The blades are inset too far to work as a mustache trimmer. It has a hard time keeping up with large amounts of hair and cutting it evenly. It's just not worth the money. My older clipper that was of similar design without the vacuum was much better.
  650. I use this about every 3 days. I have always had Norelco products, but love this one the best ! The built in vacuum keeps the blades clear of whiskers from clumping up like my last one. Very easy to clean, and I love the digital read out.
  651. As one who is generally disappointed by nearly every gadget I buy in one way or another, I am surprised to say that this is indeed the best beard trimmer I've ever owned. High marks in every category: form, function, versatility... the vacuum doesn't catch all hairs, but most, which is more than I would have expected. Only time will tell if it holds up, but really it's cheap enough that one could buy a new one every five or six months if need be.
  652. Great to have the 0.5mm steps and the display of the adjustment. Great to have the battery charge guage. Fast charging is also a great feature. Fits the hand well.<br />I recommed havig the vacuum over not having one but done expect it to get all the hairs.<br /><br />I bought this to replace a Remington MB 70. The Norelco is better in all ways except that the vacuum doesn't quite work as well and there are more hairs trapped in the removable comb. Since the MB 70 doesnt seem to be availavle any more and the batteries gave out on mine this is the next best thing.
  653. I hate this thing. The vacuum, one of its main selling-points, works very poorly and only collects about 25% of the hair. There is a gap which allows hair to enter into the spinning mechanism.<br /><br />I had the previous model which was better. I can't understand how this company can re-design something so that it doesn't work as well. I couldn't care less about the digital component of this.
  654. The Vacuum is weak but what a nice tool!
  655. My boyfriend uses this, not me, but he loves it. It seems reliable. He has had it for about a year and a half now and hasn't complained!
  656. Despite mixed reviews on this item, I decided to go ahead and purchase it.<br /><br />I have owned it for roughly 6 months now and am very satisfied.<br /><br />I keep a short beard and have not had any issues. Vacuum function works great when the turbo mode is on (I always leave it on). The vacuum is not 100%, but it gets most so that a simple wipe down on the sink gets rid of all the remaining hairs. My girlfriend never nags me about hairs in the sink (thank God)<br /><br />Cleaning the razor is super easy, just open vacuum compartment door and empty.<br /><br />I use the stiff comb, based on the reviews here that people were having trouble with the contour following comb. I have not had any issue with the stiff comb so I just been sticking with it.<br /><br />Battery life has been great, charges fast and last several trims.<br /><br />Good quality razor, was worth every penny.<br /><br />Don't understand why so many negative reviews, am I not enough of a razor expert in order to critique it further?<br /><br />Regular guy here definitely recommends this razor

  658. F$&ked after 3 months.
  659. I like how it works. The vacuum does work, but mostly on shorter hair. The battery holds a charge for quite a while, however if you do any body grooming with the razer, then you should leave it plugged in.
  660. ok, first the good: It looks good. It shaves ok. The battery seems ok (second time around). Works from the outlet without needing to be recharged.<br /><br />now - not so good:<br />This whole vacuum thing is a joke. At best it get half of the shaving.<br />Latch on the shaving compartment is very flimsy. It broke of within the first couple of month requiring scotch to keep door closed. Previous models had this compartment removable without the need for doors.<br />For $50 might have included a stand.
  661. After being fearful of replacing my T980 for some time, I finally broke down and bought this trimmer after one of the comb tines broke on it. The new one arrived today, I charged it up and tried it. Damn, it's a honey!! Aside from not being able to pull the hair receptacle out to dump those little suckers in the trash like the 980 let me do (this one's hinged), which I prefer, this is a terrific trimmer. I'm only sorry I didn't decide to replace my old (apparently worn out) one some time ago.
  662. I'm probably one of the laziest people alive when it comes to beard grooming. I trim my beard because of a policy at work. Keeping that in mind, I quickly run over my beard once a week with this trimmer. And for the most part it does a decent job. It comes with 2 combs, one that contours to your face, and one that stabs you. Leave the second one in the box, it's worthless. I usually get 3 trims out of the battery, which is cool, but pointless. When's the last time you were in a bathroom with no outlet? The trimmer is adjustable for cut length, which is my favorite feature of this product. It adjusts in 1mm increments, and it tells you on the LED display what length you're at. Pretty cool. Another cool thing about this trimmer is how easily it pops apart and snaps back together for cleaning. Now on to what is not so cool. The vacuum feature is a gimmick. It fills up immediately and sometimes to the point that hairs are backed up and blocking the trimmer blades from cutting. You have to stop and empty it, but yet there are still hairs all over my sink. So it really only catches some of the trimmed hairs. You'll still have to clean up the sink and counter afterward. Personally, I'd rather skip the mid-trim emptying, and just let it all fall. The other thing I find lacking with this trimmer is the ability to edge. The blades are located in such a way that it's difficult to get my upper lip, near my nostrils. I end up using scissors there, which does not go with my lazy beard grooming philosophy. Update: Now I've had several months to use this trimmer. I'm reducing it from 3 stars down to 2 stars. The little door that holds the vacuumed hair no longer stays closed. The snap has broken, allowing the door to flap around if I don't keep my thumb on it. And I still find it annoying that I have to empty it constantly during trims. Comparing this to my previous trimmer, a $10 Wahl Beard that lasted me over 5 years, this product is clearly not in it for the long haul. Piece ofjunk...and an expensive one at that. Update 5/21/17: I've had this trimmer a few years now. About 6 months ago I noticed that the battery quit holding a charge. If I unplug it, the trimmer will only run a few seconds before turning off. It's now a corded trimmer. Also, the springs inside the contouring comb always pop out when I remove it for cleaning. EVERY SINGLE TIME. The little plastic clips that hold the springs in place are no longer functional. This product has reached the end of it's run with me. I did manage to get almost 3.5 years of use before calling it quits, but I wouldn't say I was a happy customer during that time. I've ordered a corded Wahl Peanut to replace this trimmer. Something I probably should have done a long time ago, but I wanted to get my $50 out of this product. Funny, the Peanut sells for $40. So in summary, I really have no clue why this product has such a high user rating. I do wonder if most of the users rate it after a single use and never look back. Because really, and I mean REALLY, this trimmer was pretty much a huge letdown. I do not recommend it for any use for anyone. Here's to hoping the Peanut works out much better than this...
  663. The latch which holds the hair is made of cheap, thin plastic. Within a few weeks of regular use the plastic latch broke and fell off. I got a replacement but that, too, broke within a few weeks. Now I have a rubber band to hold the door shut - a poor solution for what was supposed to be a great razor.

(Drilled holes for two self-tapping screws which works fine, but removal for cleaning was getting to be a chore). This one has the same design flaw, but only time will tell if they've used a more durable plastic.<br />The QT4070/41 7300 feels good in the hand, on the face and moving through the beard. I miss the pop-up mustache trimmer that my first Norelco trimmer had, but the vacuum feature doesn't leave room for one. I added their battery-powered detailing shaver/trimmer to my arsenal last year, as I maintain a close trimmed van dyke (goatee plus mustache).<br />Hardly any trimmings left in the sink, and easy to use. Setting is locked, so no depressing the comb with the application of pressure, so it's the safest one yet! Better collection box design (hinged), and it's less bulky and slightly shorter than the T980.

  691. I had an older version of the Norelco beard trimmer which I used regularly until the hair collection cup fell apart. This new one improves on every single element of that one, which is rare for most products, so I had to give it five stars. My wife likes the look of using this without the guard on the majority of my facial hair (which is fine with me - no razor burn), so I use this every other day to cut everything down and then with the guard to manage my goatee and sideburns.<br /><br />The cup was replaced with a very secure door, so I don't expect that to fall apart anytime soon, and there's nowhere for hair to collect outside of the cup because there is no cup. This was a weak point on the old model. The new model uses a lithium ion battery versus the old NiCad - I don't feel a need to go into the benefits there. There is a nice battery indicator replacing what used to be just a blinking red light. The guard height is a backlit digital number - much easier to see than the old one. These are all improvements over a trimmer that was good enough I would have bought another of the old one if needed. It is easy to get precise trim lines, and the turbo mode cranks up the trimmer speed and vacuum to the point where almost nothing drops and you don't even have to be careful to get everything. This is just an excellent trimmer in every way.
  692. I was searching for years for the perfect stubble beard trimmer, and I'm glad I finally found this one. I tried almost every brand and didn't find what I was looking for - they all had flaws. I virtually have no complaints and look forward to shaving with this puppy!<br /><br />- Cuts evenly and perfectly, gives me that truly 1 day stubble look whenever I want<br />- Does not tug or pull<br />- Both attachments work great (comes with a standard guide, and a contour guide)<br />- Has a turbo mode which I haven't even needed to use yet, but nice knowing it has it<br />- Doesn't feel cheap, isn't too heavy<br />- The LCD is great, all electronic, even the lengths<br />- The vacuum system is a nice bell and whistle, but it isn't 100% effective. I still shave standing in the shower so that there's absolutely no mess to clean up. But still, you can feel the soft air being blown from the vacuum and it's kind of soothing to the skin.<br /><br />Love this thing!

  726. I realy like it. It works well and because of the vacuum it keeps my sink nice and clean.<br /><br />A few more notes:<br /><br />The battery life seems to be quite good. Makes getting various lengths easy and it's awesome not having a bunch of clip-on guards laying around for the different lengths.<br /><br />Great product.
  727. Long charge, even shaving, vacuum hair collection a big plus
  728. A very good trimmer. However I am on my second and the first wasn't even a year old. I didn't have time for the warranty return route when the first one died so I had to buy a new one. Then I made a warranty claim and the broken one was replaces without any problem. The issue is recharging the battery. They warn you to only recharge it for 70 minutes. This is really important. I was pretty good about this for 8-9 recharges and the unit worked very well. Then one time I forgot and left it plugged in for 4 hours. The unit would never hold a charge after that and eventually it wouldn't even run with the charger attached. A good trimmer but when you are charging it use a timer to make sure you don't over charge it! If it didn't have this charging issue (which is very easy to fix) I would give it 5 stars.
  729. Best everyday trimmer that I own. It works well without any tugging and very little mess. Should have bought one much earlier.
  730. Looks like a good and well designed product, but unfortunately it doesn't work well. It doesn't trim as evenly as my previous Panasonic trimmer. The worst part is that it won't hold a charge.. I plug it in to charge it, and it looks like it's charging. The next day, I go to use it and it won't turn on. It only works with the cord.
  731. It's ok, but I had another Philips Norelco Beard Trimmer that worked the same way, but it had two heads on it that enter changed and I liked that one better. One was a smaller head that I could trim with better. Any way that one finally stopped working but it was a good one.

  734. Used it a few times now, working really well on 1/3&#34; beard trimming. Potent motor, turbo function is a plus.
  735. Purchased this last summer and have not had any qualms with it since. The adjustable height is nice for trimming facial hair to a uniform height and the vacuum is effective at capturing the majority of the hair and not leaving a mess in your bathroom. The &#34;stubble&#34; setting is a bit ineffective and found it easier to remove the guard all together and take to the face directly. Can run a little warm but that's to be expected with any sheering mechanism as the friction builds up.<br /><br />Would recommend to those who can't be bothered to shave on a regular basis and prefer the elegantly disheveled look as I do.
  736. This is really really great, I am happy with this purchase it is pretty much just what I needed. Albeit a bit small ... but overall it is hassle free, and it hasn't pinched me yet, which is why I got a new shaving device; my Panasonic I just got pinches my hair, so does the Norelco, but Philips, it seems they did this one just right!   737. Works very well. Best trimmer Ive used so far. Length is easily selectable by twisting a knob. The charger is the same as the Senso Touch 3D so instead of having multiple charging cables I can just switch them out whenever one of them need charging.<br /><br />So far I have not experienced a bad product from Norelco and will continue to purchase them.

  745. This thing is ALL plastic. One drop to the floor and its gona bust! And this will likely happen because there is NO grip at all.. One is pointy and inaccurate and the other ones shortest length starts at around 2.5mm length... making it hard to get a good clean-ish scruff look. I have to rake this over my face over and over to get all the hair which it just won't do, always have to finish with a cheap $20 Remington. The vacuum kinda works but don't get all the hair so you have to actually clean out two things now, the trimmer and the left overs in the sink..   747. UPDATE: APRIL 2015, less than a year after purchase.<br />This week my unit died (purchased May 2014). Problem with charging. Unit shows flashing yellow light pushing power on button.<br />Unit still works with charger plugged into outlet.<br />Charging overnight, next day - same thing. Called in for warranty replacement. They are sending a replacement and PP shipper for return.<br />All well and good, but hoping for a unit that will last longer than (under) 11 months!!!!<br /><br />Original review:<br />I bought this to replace my T780, whose batteries eventually died.<br />It came with two combs, the contour-following comb being the same as that on my T780.<br />That made it possible for me to buy and use it - I have use for only the contour-following comb.<br />The unit works well under all the same conditions I used the T780.<br />Norelco has always done some things on all their rechargeable products that are customer-hostile and have really irked me.<br />The first is the inability to replace batteries. I have successfully replaced batteries on their shavers, but their other products are essentially impossible.<br />Secondly, unlike their shavers, you could never operate the trimmers with the charging cord plugged in. So they became useless when the batteries were dead, or if they lost their charge in the middle of a trimming - most annoying.<br />Thirdly, using primitive NiCad batteries just sucks.<br /><br />Well the first problem is still here. It may be possible to replace the battery, but if so, it's not going to be simple and certainly not for the faint of skill. Oh, well - at least it's a Lithium Ion battery now, so at least issue #3 has been addressed at long last.<br /><br />The big delight is that issue #3 has been addressed. Hallelujah. You can plug the bloody thing in and use it.<br /><br />As I said at the outset, this unit works well under all identical circumstances. I find it to be a worthy replacement for the T780.<br />The stubble collector bin door is a bit sketchy, and looks like the weak component. Making this user-replaceable would have been smart. You can have this replaced under warranty if it breaks within 2 years.<br />The blades seem absolutely identical to the T780, and that looks like the only component that is interchangeable.<br />I would recommend this product, I can't find anything better.<br /><br />See my product update at the top of this review.smart. You can have this replaced under warranty if it breaks within 2 years. The blades seem absolutely identical to the T780, and that looks like the only component that is interchangeable. I would recommend this product, I can't find anything better. See my product update at the top of this review.
  748. This is a great item for facial trimming. If you have more body hair (chest, legs, etc) This item is not sufficient.

  750. Bought this for my husband and he loves it!!! I would recommend to anyone!!
  751. The plastic feels a bit flimsier than my previous Norelco trimmer. The comb stays in place and locked in to the length setting you choose. The vacuum chamber gets in the way of the trimmer blades and that makes it difficult to square off the edges of your beard or sideburns. You need to hold the trimmer almost completely perpendicular to your skin to get the blades to touch the edges of your beard.<br /><br />Update:October 2014<br />The plastic tab that holds the hair clippings in has broken and now must be held with a rubber band or by hand. Periodically the digital number that indicates the trim level goes berserk. I have to remove the entire head and blade assembly, move the selector dial up and down several times and eventually it will reset. Could be a disaster if the dial reads \\"5\\" but the blade is actually set to 1. OOPS - there goes your beard.<br /><br />I wouldn't buy this again.
  752. Bought a new one to replace a lost one of same type. I have a short beard and have tried many other brands before. This is the best.<br />Vacuum function is effective, avoiding the mess almost totally.
  753. A little unwieldy. Not great for getting close to edges, not very precise. Sort of thick and clunky.
  754. I'm using this trimmer for about a year. Generally it's working nice, but for me there some major problems:<br />1. it comes without a case<br />2. sometimes the hair stucks in the storage so it's not so easy to out of there with the provided brush<br />3. the battery life isn't so long, I had a previous model, which had a much better battery<br />4. the vacuum still not so effective
  755. UPDATE TO THE BELOW... After less than a year, the battery only lasts a couple minutes if lucky. The power cord plug easily slips out of the bottom (and could drop in sink of water if you're not careful) as the plug doesn't seat itself solidly into the body of the trimmer. And finally, The little plastic door you open to remove the hair from the trap had its clasp wear out after just a few months, so no it just flaps around loosely and spills hair everywhere unless you're careful about holding it down. So, off the shelf, this is great, but it becomes a pain to use after a year. One fix for the cord is that you could super-glue it into the body of the trimmer since the battery won't end up being practical after a year anyway, and then that solves the dangerous problem of the cord plug constantly falling out...but then you have to be near an outlet. At this point you might as well buy a $40 T-edger trimmer that will last you much longer. This was a replacement item for a Panasonic ER-GS60-S trimmer that died after less than a year of use. The Panasonic was great while it lasted (not quite as good as this one), but the battery not being able to hold a decent charge after less than a year is unacceptable. I wish I had found this Norelco trimmer sooner as it functions slightly better than the Panasonic with its vacuum and because the guard locks in place with the turn of the dial (the Panasonic's guard would get bumped out of place sometimes, although I think they also have a new model with a dial to fix that). But I like that I can use this while plugged into the wall whereas the Panasonic was limited to operating after charging on the stand for a while. It's a little loud with the turbo mode on...louder than a regular pair of Wahl or Conair hair clippers, but not obnoxiously loud. You may or may not wake someone sleeping with the bathroom door shut. Regular mode, you're probably fine, but I always use Turbo for my beard. It doesn't catch all the hairs with the vacuum, but I'd say it catches about 85-90% which still helps dramatically with cleanup. The hair-trap door swings outward, pivoting from a hinge that's located on the right side...you have to give a slightly aggressive push and pull on the left side to swing it open. If you buy straight from Norelco, it now ships directly with the contouring head that everyone is raving about in the comments (apparently they removed it on the original change from the older model, but they now give you both heads in the packaging) so rest assured, this comes with everything you need. The head has the widest range of lengths I've seen on any unit so far, and allows you to adjust 1mm at a time which is nice. I use this for a short stubble trim all the way up to side-burn cleanup, so the range is very nice. It's also very safe for body grooming, so this really does it all. I can't think of anything I dislike...it could maybe use a slightly stronger vacuum, but that may increase bulk of the trimmer and decrease battery life, so I can't really complain. This fits nicely into my compact / travel shaving kit, so I like it just how it is.
  756. ehhh, trying to get a close shave with this &#34;vacuum shaver&#34; is not all that easy. I wish the blades could have been designed to be pushed up, so that the blades can get in really close, but no dice.
  757. well mine runs about 1-2 min. on a full charge and than the red light comes on showing that the battery is low. when you take the beard combs off it wont shave close enough to even touch a weeks worth of stubble. my other clippers cut stubble nice and short, they just don't have a vacuum, I quit using a normal razor because my neck seems to get reall iritated so i just use a trimmer to cut the stubble as short as possible but that just does not work on these.<br /><br />now when i trim the long part of my beard it works quiete well, if the battery did not start dying so fast, the vaccume probably gets95% or more of the hair. there is usually only a few hair clippings laying on the counter that i just brush into the trashcan, so very little mess<br /><br />i imagine i just got a defective unit as far as the battery goes, ill probably have this one replaced or just return it.

  792. Having used numerous trimmers over the past 15 years, I have seen improvements in trimmers but am still looking for the perfect one. I was looking for a cordless rechargeable trimmer, with quick charge, Lithium Ion battery for sure, with a vacuum and adjustable head that trimmed well.<br />I think I made the best available choice.<br /><br />Pros:<br />Lithium Ion battery - 1 hour charge - good battery life<br />Vacuum that works somewhat<br />Both types of trimmer heads included (Philips learned).<br />Regular and Turbo trimming<br /><br />Cons:<br />Vacuum only works somewhat<br />Trimming results a little uneven.<br /><br />Bottom line, I think this device has the best combination of attributes available, now I just have to be a better user of the tool. Hopefully I will grow to like this one even better as I get better with it.

  797. I purchased this shaver about a year ago to trim my beard and moustache. One comb came with it. I called Norelco (866-779-0279) to purchase the new contoured comb. Guess what...it cost me $24.90, including shipping. What a rip off! I hope it solves the problem. If not, I'll be back here to write another review about the contoured comb.<br /><br />I had hoped Norelco would have sent the contoured comb for free and apologized for the trouble the original comb caused me.   800. Picked this guy up recently and was excited to see how many ways I could put this to work. Mustache/beard trimmers I've had in the past have always been excellent multi-taskers, allowing me to trim much more than the name suggests.<br /><br />One use I've always found incredibly nice is the ability to trim eyebrows. Unfortunately, as I've gotten older, I've got more and more eyebrow hairs that just decide &#34;welp! It's OLD time! Time to grow extremely thick and long!&#34; so I've had to start clippering them regularly. With my old trimmer, this was no big deal. Set for #3 blade, press against the right temple, apply a little pressure to get the hairs to stand up, and run it across the brow.<br /><br />With this unit, the plastic is so soft on the blade guard that rather than causing the hair to stand up, the guard just bends. Now I have eyebrows that are almost non-existent toward my temples, and nearly regular length on my nose bridge.<br /><br />Beard/mustache trimming are excellent, and I like the contour following guide better than the one that comes on the unit itself. I just wish that one or both were made of stiffer materials.
  801. I had an older model that finally died. I found this one to hold it's setting better and really like the digital battery readout. The attached vacuum is a huge plus. It's also light than the older model. It's a keeper!
  802. it is almost the same as the one I wore out had it many year's This one has a few improvements
  803. Wonderful way to deal with the beard, trimming rather than shaving. I will never shave again!! I trim to 1/32 of an inch twice a week and my wife is happy and so am I. Brilliant!!!
  804. I bought this hoping it would keep the sink cleaner than the trimmer I was using. Well, the vacuum part of it does seem to work, so the whiskers mostly end up in the little compartment. But then you have to clean the compartment anyway, so the trimmings still end up getting loose anyway. Meanwhile, this thing is noisy. I pretty much have to insert earplugs to protect my hearing when trimming near my ears. And it doesn't trim very well, really. You have to go really slowly, and over and over and over again to get all the whiskers. The corded trimmer is much quicker and gives more even cut. I went back to the corded, and this now sits in my drawer.
  805. I used to trim my beard with a little $5 set of clippers and these work MUCH better. The battery seems to last a long time as well. I like how it trims everything easily and isn't too messy.
  806. Very powerful and fast my concern is without head you still get rough beard i had an old one used to provide better results
  807. Vacuum function is lacking for sure and would be nice if it had an attached pop up mini trimmer to get more precisely around the mouth and ears.
  808. Craftsmanship is excellent. Adjustment for my short goatee seems to be a little tricky. Still experimenting, but I can't quite seem to get it dialed in. It's either too short or too long. Could be me ... or not. Excellent battery life. Vacuum mostly works.
  809. Great trimmer. I use it almost everyday. Shaving (electric or razor) just gives me cuts. This on the otherhand is great. No cuts. Charge keeps for a long time. The vacuum doesn't pick up all of the trimmings, but it helps a lot with the cleanup.
  810. The vacumn is nothing to write home about.
  811. I purchased this nearly 2 years ago to the day. It is a decent shaver/trimmer of average to below average quality. The vacuum feature is nice but not 100%. Unfortunately, the clear compartment that snaps shut to hold trimmings latches with a flimsy, brittle plastic tab that broke off on mine 1 year ago. Now the compartment just flaps in the wind. My fix for that was to attach a rubber band around it to keep the trimmings from blowing out all over the place. Replacement parts for this unit are ridiculously priced so don't even bother checking. Are you going to spend nearly $30 for a new cutter head when you paid $45 for the unit? Today while trimming beard, the unit started giving me errors and stopping. After investigation, I found that you can easily remove the cutter unit. Inside it was jammed with beard trimmings. I was never aware that there is a second place trimmings accumulate. I cleaned the trimmings out of the cutter unit and fixed the jam. No big deal but it appears that besides emptying trimmings from the obvious compartment, you need to periodically clean the cutter head. Now on to the battery life. For the first year I could charge this unit and get 4 or 5 uses out of it. Now the battery is much weaker and lasts 1 maybe 2 uses. No easy battery replacement and none that I could find. It requires dis-assembly of unit. Again this reinforces my belief that this is a throwaway unit. I would have paid more for one that had replaceable batteries and cutter units that were reasonably priced. Overall the fit and finish is what you would expect with a low to mid level consumer device. The clipping compartment door will eventually break off and the vacuum feature become useless. My advice is to purchase a cheaper unit you know you will be chucking out in a couple years, or go with a higher quality unit with better construction and decent, available reasonably priced consumables.<br /><br />Picture 1 shows unit with cutter head removed for cleaning and the notorious plastic clippings compartment, small plastic tab simply fatigued and broke off (should have been a metal clip) Picture 2 shows other side of unit with cutter head removed as reference. I couldn't get a better photo of the clear plastic compartment cover but as you can see it is just cheap plastic and that tab will break off sooner or later.ng and the notorious plastic clippings compartment, small plastic tab simply fatigued and broke off (should have been a metal clip) Picture 2 shows other side of unit with cutter head removed as reference. I couldn't get a better photo of the clear plastic compartment cover but as you can see it is just cheap plastic and that tab will break off sooner or later.
  812. I shopped for a good versatile trimmer that could leave the 5 o'clock shadow look with precision. I was very happy to find a model that had a vacuum to help curb the mess on the sink that other razors leave. It doesn't totally prevent the mess, but I don't have to shave outside anymore--it does a good job. The digital depth indicator is great as well. I really like this razor and expect to use it for many years. The number of depth settings makes it very versatile.
  813. the best beard trimmer i've ever used. I don't have to clean up at all. The position and length stay very well. the charge stays good for a long time. Nothing is wrong with this product, at all!
  814. The vacuum on this shaver sounded kinda gimmicky, like a Flobie for beards, but it has its uses. For me, it was helpful for quick touch-ups on my sideburns and, with my wife's help, for cleaning up my neck in the back and around my ears. Unfortunately, I keep my stubble shorter than this shaver was really good for. Generally, I use a Wahl without a guard, which is extremely close. The Norelco Vacuum needs slightly longer beards, but was great for trimming when I grew me beard out while camping. If a longer beard was my look, I would really like this device. Like other reviewers, I did find it hard to trim under my nose, but elsewhere it was fine and produced less mess. So, for touch ups and beards longer than a few millimeters the Norelco Vacuum works well.
  815. Very unhappy with this product. The plastic latch to the hair trap broke after a couple of months, forcing me to tape it shut so it wouldn't hang open. As a result the razor is constantly clogged with hair.
  816. The product is way underpowered. I have moderately thick hair and it takes me a full charge to do a trim because I have to go over and over my beard. Its not just a problem with my specific trimmer - I have other Philips products. The vacuum gets about 75% of the clippings, but I'd much rather have more juice going to the clippers - whats the point in a vacuum if the clippers suck?<br />[Note: it is underpowered even in the turbo setting, the regular setting it useless]<br /><br />The attachments are flimsy - very thin plastic that bends and breaks easily. The Philips warranty does not cover these, so they gouge customers on the cost of replacing crappy attachments.<br /><br />Philips Customer Service Representatives are truly the worst reps I've ever encountered. They do not know basic facts about the companies products or policies. Every call takes 30+ minutes and ends with the rep saying they can't help with even basic requests: it took 10 minutes for the last rep to find the product number on their computer! I asked one rep if their job was really even intended to be helpful to customers and he said his job was really just to deflect complaints.<br /><br />This product has a 45-day money-back guarantee, but you have to use the product for 21-days and it takes Philips a week to process your return request. Since the return must be postmarked by the 45th day, you only have a tiny window to return the product on time. They basically made the guarantee useless, especially since it took me 45 minutes to get the customer service representative to fill in my information for a return. UPDATE: They told me they would process my return within 3-5 days, its been 10 days and I have 2 days left on the guarantee. I spent another 45 minutes with a rep and they said I would be okay to return the shaver in 3 days - the 46th day after buying the shaver! I made it extremely clear I had to have the return before then, they knew when I purchased the shaver. Additionally, the product reps take care of 2+ customers at a time (they admitted this to me when I confronted them about all the long pauses on hold).<br /><br />And overall, the product feels flimsy and is made of lightweight plastic. This product is not meant to last, they've focused on gimmicky details rather than a good, reliable product. I bought this reluctantly after pieces broke on my last Philips trimmer, and its battery didn't last long enough to give me a good trim, nor was it powerful enough. This product had better reviews, but shame on me for getting fooled twice. The positive reviews are people with thin beards who were smitten with the product during the first week - I'm certain they regret the purchase a few weeks later. I'm going back to Wahl - my last one lasted 10 years!<br /><br />NOTE:<br />55 days after I originally purchased the trimmer (10 days after the guarantee ended), I got an automated email from Philips asking me to complete a survey and product review. I cut & pasted the above review. An hour later, Philips finally emailed me a return slip for the 45-Day Guarantee. The next day, they emailed me saying they were removing my product review!!! I had to report them to the BBB and write a negative review on their site to get them to honor their guarantee, then they censor the reviews of their products - completely unethical.
