  850. There's one reason somebody would buy this beard trimmer and that's for the vacuum feature. While it's not perfect, it certainly does the job. You may still have some clippings around the sink but it does suck up 90% of them which is 90% more than any other machine<br />It comes with a contour flowing comb, which I've read older models advertised but did not contain in the box so Phillips have fixed that.<br />I do not have a strong beard so for me, I remove the comb and use the machine on the lowest setting which is 0.5mm for an even stubble and buying this machine was all about the vacuum.<br />One downfall is that, the blades do not protrude enough which means holding the machine upside down and creating an outline for your beard or sideburns is not possible. For this I switch up to a small $10 machine I have lying around just for that.<br />It's a solid build and bulkier than any machine I have had and slightly loud, but I think that's just because of the vacuum feature. Charges quickly and so far I've used it for about 30-40 minutes in total and haven't charged it since the initial charge. Good led indicator for charge too.<br />Overall, it would be better if the blade protruded out a little more so i didnt have to use a second machine for sideburns but the vacuum feature is the sole reason I bought this in the first place and I'm quite happy with it.
  851. Dont waste your time or money. While a great idea, the vacuum system on this trimmer makes it almost worthless.
  852. perfect beard trimmer.
  853. I've had a beard the thickness of a lumberjack for the past 15 years or so and have tried(and killed) quite a few trimmers. For the longest time I actually just used a regular industrial barbershop electric clipper(for the head) which there is no comparison for the ability to mow down the chops in no time. That said, it's not so good on fine facial features, setting length, and portability.<br /><br />This is by far the most versatile and utilitarian beard trimmer I've used. The length settings are locked in(opposed to a slide guard found on many) at the MM length and no worry about the length attachment accidentally sliding creating a bald landing strip on you check. The rotary click dial makes it easy to set and read. There are two power settings on here but due to my thickness I just use the turbo all the time. I can't say much about battery life on the go since I keep it plugged in most of the time. One nice feature though is that when the batter IS dead, you can plug in and use. Some I've owned in the past require the battery to juice back up before you can use which is really annoying.<br /><br />The vacuum function is a neat idea but still needs some perfection. When it's advertised as &#34;no mess,&#34; it should be more accurately put as &#34;less mess.&#34; It's true, you don't have clippings flying all over the counter, nor is it without a few. I'd say around 70% get trapped and the rest fall.<br /><br />All in all a good clipper, will see how it holds up over a few years.
  854.   862. I read loads of reviews before deciding on this one. My main concern was that everyone said the trimmer cut their lip, but further comments said that the second (more traditional) guard was now supplied and so it was great. Based on this i bought it. What i found was that the second guard worked fine, but really didnt cut the stubble short enough. I found that it left me looking too unshaven, scruffy, like i wasnt making an effort (def not good enough for the office). What i had seen on one post was a guy saying that he had read the other reviews and despite that was having no problems with the main guard and that actually it gave him a closer shave. So i decided to give that a go and * definitely* found that the normal guard was better for me. Im super careful when doing my lip because of all the warnings people had, but so far have not cut my lip at all, and have goten a way closer shave than with the second head everyone was asking for. With this main head i get a really awesome length of stubble which is exactly what i was looking for. It takes about 10mins to do, is noisy but makes very little mess in the bathroom, and has really great results. From my experience of a few months its turned out to be a 5 star razor for getting a great stubble look. I would highly recommend this.
  863. This trimmer is a definite step up from my older Norelco, which essentially had only the most basic feature of a trimmer: An adjustable guide. In the interest of deciding whether it's worth it to spend the additional money, I will compare the two. The QT4070 blade cuts very smoothly and evenly, much better than my old Norelco. The old Norelco (without vacuum) had clippings all over the sink and counter--the QT4070 vacuum captures around 97%, which leaves the sink and counter pretty clean. The QT4070 battery keeps its charge well. The QT4070 digital readout ensures I have it set to the correct length, and lets me know how much battery power remains. There is, however, the need to be more careful in the use of the QT4070 than my old Norelco. The QT4070 has a gap between the top guard and the side guard, which leaves the cutting surface more exposed. (I.e., you can stick your chin between the guards, and get closer to the trimmer than the guard setting would otherwise allow.) On the old Norelco it was impossible to bring the cutting surface too close since the guard covered 100% of the cutting surface. I was initially concerned, but got the hang of it by the second use. Conclusion: The QT4070 is of course a luxury, but it does deliver for the additional price. Any trimmer will do the job. For the additional cost, the QT4070 will provide a smoother and more even cut, with a much cleaner sink and counter, keeping its charge well, and providing a clear digital readout.
  864. OK, for those guys out there who cultivate that \\"I don't need to shave everyday\\" look, this may be the thing for you. I like a clean line 'tween my goatee and the rest, so it's not my bag. I thought I would give it a try for those times I wanted to cut down the goatee, too. Doesn't cut long enough for that.<br />At first pass it seems well made, nice controls and a good battery. The 'vacuum' deal is a mixed bag of tricks - it doesn't really work that well. It did keep some of the stubble from falling in the sink, but I could take or leave it.<br />The thing is SHARP however. No pulling or tugging or any of that. And when you do use it for leaving stubble, it does a great, even job. If I were into that, this would be my choice. Very nice for the price!

  879. Since everybody wants to see the cons - the capacity of the clippings container only lasts half a trim before it spits hair everywhere. Lesson learned I empty it more often now.<br /><br />This trimmer feels nice in the hand. I thought at first I wouldn't like it because I was used to a trimmer with a curve, but it's great. The vacuum works quite well (until its hopper is full), it's not overly loud nor is it an annoying noise maker. The display is very helpful, showing you charge status as well as length settings. It also came with 2 types of &#34;caps&#34; for lack of a better word. Plus, since it will run off the cord even if/when the battery gives up, if you don't want to replace it you don't have to.
  880. This light trimmer is great. I chose it because of its 18-length settings plus 1-more without a comb. It has so many features, I can't think of anything else I'd want. It charges quickly, and can also be used with the supplied cord. I was skeptical about the vacuum feature, but it really works, even without using the boost feature. It collects virtually all hair if you don't let the collection chamber get too full and brush off the filter. It comes with two combs, one of which is a spring loaded contour comb. A reviewer said tines were sharp and hurt, but I had no problem. If you do, it's simple to hold the tines near the tips for support and use a jeweler's file to smooth. 5-stars for sure.
  881. best since the 980. good that they now include the guiding comb, but hard to use the blade only portion to trim upper lip etc due to shape even when you take comb off
  882. Very Good excellent!!! Nice smooth comfortable enjoyable new useful necessary a must have. I feel better about myself now. Look out new and improve me.
  883. I am a guy who does not like a clean shave. I like a very little amount of stubble, so with this Norelco model I can trim my beard without a comb and just get a very close shave, without it being clean. It's better for my acne and I enjoy the look that it gives.<br /><br />At times the suction feels like it gets clogged and you have to scrape some of your hairs out to get it going again. Also the battery lasts for a long time, but once it drops below half the second half goes very quick.<br /><br />All in all this is the one device I use to shave my face. It's multi purpose because you can use it to trim other parts of your body too. Would really recommend someone who wants not a clean, but close, shave give this a go.
  884. The vacuum cleaner of the Norelco really works well. I was looking for this feature.<br />The precision is quite good.<br />The seller send the item in a nice packed way.
  885. Simply a great beard trimmer. First off I don't go for the stubble look, I keep my trimmer set to around 10-13 mm. It works great, just keep in mind when going from a longer beard to much shorter your need to go in steps. The vacuum works great and gets most of the trimming. I can't say it get's them all but having 80-90% less hair to clean out of the bathroom sink is a great thing!
  886. I've had the product for a couple of months now and it works. I can see the potential for breakage with some of the plastic pieces but the trimmer works well and the vacuum does pick up most of the trimmings for an easier sink cleanup.
  887. I love it, It's light, handles easily, and retains it's charge well.
  888. I always tried to trim my beard with scissors and one of the big trimmers that you can use on your head. Then one day I manned up and bought one of these. The difference is amazing. I wondered how some guys had that perfectly groomed beard. This is a major part of that. Man up, get the right tools. This is the right tool.
  889. Bought this for my boyfriend and he loved it! And I love the fact that it vacuums the hair - less mess left behind in the bathroom! Just make sure you dump out the hair before transporting it as movement will cause the hair to fall out everywhere from the trimmer!

  891. Had it for about a month now. No issues or problems. Hopefully it last as long as my previous shaver.
  892. The vacuum is awesome. I like stubble beard and it does the job right. The only reason I didn't give it a five star because I almost cut my upper lips trying to trim my mustache.
  893. Let me start by saying that I typically use the trimmer set at 12 mm (so my beard is a bit longer than those in other reviews). I can't saw how this trimmer works for short stubble but I don't like it for my longer beard. I trim every 2 weeks and I find that the vacuum is not strong enough for my hair, the drawer for the trimmed hair fills up quick, it's not a very even trim, and it's not a strong trimmer. A lot of the reviews seemed to be for shorter beards and it might work great for those but for my beard this doesn't cut it. This might be one of the two worst purchases I've made on Amazon but it might be fine for someone who just wants to keep a very short stubble. I still use it just because I have it but I often find myself going back to my broken Wahl to finish the job right (so it says something that a broken trimmer does a better job than this one).
  894. Great machine. i would say it's my first one, but Nevertheless - i'm very Satisfied.<br /><br />UPDATE - 09.2015:<br />I'm sorry to say that the vacuum feature isn't working anymore :(<br />what a bummer. I really liked it.<br />I'm downgrading a star for this, so - 4 star is my new grade.
  895. Philips does it again.
  896. Terrible for trimming a beard - all or nothing, doesn't really do anything different between the different settings. For example I would run it over my beard at a level 4, 3, 2, and nothing would be cut. When I used my old trimmer (4 setting), a lot would come off and my beard would look clean and even.
  897. I'm not sure how little you need to cut for this to work, but the little amount of hair left on my head was too much for this. It won't cut. Hair gets stuck in the super teensy weensy vacuum hole. More hair fell out of this contraption then was caught in it. If you're prepubescent, this if for you. If you can grow hair, look elsewhere for a trimmer. Going back to my conaire held together with duck tape.
  898. I used to own the previous Phillips-Norelco trimmer model and it was amazing. After 3 years of ownership it died and the old model was replaced by this so I was forced to buy the QT4070. Problems started early on. I first noticed how flimsey and cheap it looked and felt. All breakable/light plastic that I know will not last long at all. Then I discovered after each use the battery died and you need to charge it. Also the &#34;digital light&#34; displaying the comb numbers often mis-reads and displays the wrong numbers (if it decides to work that day). The worst part of all is the stubble trimmer doesn't even trim. No, seriously, it doesn't cut the hair at all. I can work with everything else IF the product actually trims a beard. This is not a double trimmer, it only works (barely) when you have the comb on and want to trim your beard with a certain number. If you want to get a closer trim/shave (like the older model) then forget it. I strongly advise you to not to buy this and save your money. I am still perplexed why Norelco &#34;upgraded&#34; a perfectly fine product and made it into a piece of junk?
  899. I like this. This is the first real, quality trimmer I've ever had (after a series of not so great trimmers). Mostly, I love this trimmer. I use it almost every day.   901. This would get my 5 star if it were a bit easyier to clean out. But, it does collect the stubble, and you can't say that about most other brands. That is a real plus. I would buy this again.

  903. This is probably the best trimmer I've had. I really like the vacuum concept, though it doesn't work all that great in application.   908. This is a great performing trimmer, with few drawbacks. I had an older model which I used for 10 years, and I'm happy with the upgrade. I am impressed with how well the vacuum works; if you trim at least once a week, it will collect almost all of your whiskers (unless you're Robin Williams, or a member of ZZ Top). Others have been unhappy with the design of the new guide, saying it is too sharp. I agree that it is a little sharper, but I haven't found it to be a problem. I have also found that it is better for trimming my sideburns, especially in the whisker/hair blend zone. Regardless, the trimmer came with one of the old style guides as well, so it looks like they've learned their lesson on that one. Battery life is good, and charge time is very fast. The only thing I don't like is that it doesn't have the smaller mustache trimmer that older models had. Norelco has been the standard for trimmers for years, and continues to be so.

  925. This trimmer works great. It charges quickly, and if if dies in the middle of a trim, you can always plug it in.   926. This trimmer replaces an earlier version of the Norelco vacuum model. It has improved in being lighter weight, easier to hold and has a better grip.   928. In a world where you have limited time to shave your face thicket and even less to clean the sink below you there comes the mighty Philips Norelco QT4070 Vacuum Beard, Stubble and Mustache Trimmer Pro. Don't let the name fool you, this isn't just for hair clipping professionals, but for the lowly ilk like you and I as well. For weeks I struggled using a tiny trimmer with a cheap comb and eventually I quit because the mess of hair left in the sink hardly made it worth shaving my face; as a result, I watched as daily my beard grew incrementally, looking ever closer in appearance to the heckled fur on a chihuahua's back. A helpless feeling came over me because as it grew, I knew the mess my trimmer would create became larger, and drowning in my own fear and facial hair I reached out in desperation for Amazon's website, where I found the Philips Norelco QT4070 and a breath of fresh air. I cannot more highly recommend a personal grooming item short of toilet paper, if it can be counted as such. A few people have complained that the turbo button is useless; to these people I ask, what in life would not be made better with the addition of a turbo button? Your car? Your Barbecue Spare Ribs? Your wife? Come to your senses people, if you have an option between something WITH and something WITHOUT a turbo button, you take the turbo button every time. Don't ask stupid questions!<br /><br />Bottom line if you're on the fence about buying this trimmer get off the fence, build a new fence, climb on top and get off it again just to show the Philiips Norelco QT4070 how much you mean it.
  929. The vacuum system works as advertised which is awesome. However I was expecting a closer shave......the description has it going down to a .5mm setting but it actually only goes down to 1mm

  943. After reading many reviews on the Qt4070 and other beard/mustache trimmers, I took the plunge and ordered the QT4070. I received the trimmer last night and was quite impressed with the neat packaging and the clear and concise instruction sheet that came with it. It took me an hour, as expected, to charge the trimmer fully and I set forth to trim my beard. I have a very light goatee which was probably about 13-14 mm long. I started with setting the trimmer at 11 and then slowly kept going down and till I finally stopped at 8 mm. At first glance, it looks like the trimmer did a good job, but, then, I noticed that the hair length was fairly uneven at anywhere between 4 and 12 mm. Clearly disappointing. The vacuum mechanism worked reasonably well and sucked up most of the hair cuttings (about 80%). Then I tried to get a neat trim line for my mustache on the upper lip and this was where the trimmer completely failed! I took out the guide comb and tried to get a clean line for the mustache and the trimmer couldn't cut any hair. Then I tried to get a stubble trim on my neck and again, it couldn't cut at all. Needless to say, the trimmer is in the box and on it's way back to Amazon.
  944. Just awsome works like a dream.
  945. Not the closest trim but close enough (not as close as traditional clippers). The vacuum makes up for it, but I need to use it on Turbo to collect most of the clippings.
  946. unfortunately i have to agree with a couple of the criticisms in some of the reviews here. yes, the comb is poorly designed. i haven't had any problems with nicks and cuts, but it does make it very difficult to reach under the nose when trimming your mustache. my primary complaint however is that w/o the comb it doesn't trim as closely as the previous model. don't buy this if you're going for the 5 o'clock shadow look. think more of a 48-hour shadow! other than that, the vacuum does a good job of sucking in trimmings and the blue light looks cool. 3-stars.
  947. Works as expected. When battery is over, you can just plug it in and continue using it. Vacuum is powerful but some hair pieces still go around but it's way better than before :)
  948. This product has some serious design flaws that prevent if from providing an even trim on any setting other than stubble. First, the guard that sets the trim length is varying distances from the trimmer so, depending on the angle that the trimmer contacts your skin, the trim length changes. This, alone, makes it crazy hard to get an even trim. Second, there is a 3-4 mm gap in the guard over the trimmer. This allows the skin at that point to be pushed closer to the trimmer depending on how hard it is being pushed into the skin. The impact of this effect is compounded when the trimmer is on uneven surfaces, like a shin. So, between these two flaws, I am yet to get an even shave. Do yourself a favor and pass on this one.
  949. After more than 10 years using a Braun Exact 6 Universal, I was in the need of a new beard trimmer because Braun discontinued the supply of spare parts(battery and blades) for this model. The search led me to the Philips Norelco QT4070. A pretty good presentation of it`s qualities brought me to buy it and the great expectations I had vanished just by the very first use. The ergonomics of the comb and the hand holding result in a relatively uncomfortable feeling that ends with unequal beard lengths particularly the lower parts. The cut is not smooth giving the sensation that the blade is not as sharp as it should be. In addition, the mustache trimming is also uncomfortable since you can`t see the position of the blade. Pros: the vacuum and the the screen indicators of battery level and cut length.
  950. I've been using a beard trimming set I bought 2 years ago for $15 with pretty great results. But I thought it would be time to upgrade. So when I saw this product mentioned in GQ of all places, I figured it was worth a shot.<br /><br />Never mind that this is one of, if not the most, expensive beard trimmers on the market. You know that when you buy it. My problem with this trimmer, as many people have mentioned, is that it leaves a very uneven shave. I used it on both the 1mm and 0mm (removing the guard completely) settings. Both left shaved divots on my face, barely trimming the rest.   951. The vacuum design for this model makes it fun to shave. Fun in that there is no mess to clean up in and around the sink, other than emptying the stubble compartment when finished trimming. Also nice is the LED readout indicating how much battery life remains, though the battery does recharge rapidly in the event that it does die. Great product.

  965. Bought this one because of all the listed features, the other reviews made it seem like a nice trimmer.<br /><br />Problems:<br />1. Battery life, dies every 4 minutes or less when you use the vacuum.<br />2. Charge cable doesn't stay in charge port, keeps slipping out.<br />3. The design of the trimmer and attachments prevent you from getting to the hair on the upper life unless you take off the attachments, making it impossible to have your mustache/upper lip the same length as the rest of your beard.<br />4. The display can't keep track of the height of the attachment, every time you click up to a higher setting from 0, the display will flash the next size from the number on the display, then go back to the original size. Display will show 1mm when you're at 5mm, when you go to 6mm it'll flash 2mm and then go back to 1mm.<br /><br />All of these issues came up after the return window closed...I wasted my money, don't waste yours.

  976. I purchased this Philips Norelco Beard Trimmer for my husband. He already had a trimmer but his was on its last leg. I saw this one had great reviews so I made the purchase.   977. My boyfriend likes it!
  978. Trims my bread great. Battery lasts pretty long. Doesn't send hair flying everywhere and you can easily dump the hair into the sink. Overall a great trimmer.
  979. This beard trimmer works just fine. The vacuum picks up about 80% of the hairs from my beard, and the trim settings are multiple.<br /><br />The build quality is something to be desired, but portability is excellent!
  980. My husband is very happy with this product
  981. I've been very pleased with the Philips Norelco QT4070 so far. I've used it to trim my beard back to stub at least 15 times and so far I have had no problems. The vacuum suction is strong, although when I use it on &#34;turbo&#34; some bits of hair do flick out of the comb. I think that that's unavoidable. However, the vast vast majority of the hairs get sucked in...which means no mess! I just empty the vacuum into the garbage when I'm done. I have only tried the first comb, the one provided on the machine (there is another, alternate comb in the box), but it works well enough. I enjoy the electronic display too (cool blue LED lighting) and I find the adjustment system (to adjust the length of the beard) easy to use. I also appreciate the battery indicator light, which lets me know when the battery is draining away. The battery seems, to me, to have a normal lifespan between charges. I'd say 6-7 hours...or, in other words, I can use the trimmer on my beard once a day for 6-7 days before I need to recharge it. It could probably go a little longer without the charge, but I like to be on the safe side. It doesn't come with a case, but that's a small detail. I highly recommend this purchase if you need a good trimmer. I'll write back if I have any issues later on, but I have high hopes that nothing will happen. This seems like a very solidly-made trimmer.
  982. I think the product has been improved because the old reviews don't really reflect the product anymore. It comes with two combs, the stubble and contour following comb. Both feel sort of cheap, but they work pretty well. I liked the digital adjustment of this trimmer, It doesn't change on me or become loose and adjust itself like some reviewers claim. I have a coarse beard that does not grow too thick but can grow long (think Fu Manchu). So I've been using this trimmer at least 1 to 2 times per week and have no complaints. The copy says it catches about 90% of the shavings, I would say that is correct. There is still a small mess to clean at the sink, but it may take about 15 seconds to clean up. The compartment that holds the hair needs to be cleaned out pretty regularly. But I clean it over the trashcan now, instead of sending all the hair down the sink, so that's better for the plumbing. It doesn't come with a case, which was not a big deal to me, but if you travel a lot with it, you'll have to get something. All in all, I was looking for a trimmer that was powerful enough to cut my coarse facial hair and that would be easy to clean. This trimmer fit the bill nicely. If it breaks, I'll probably buy another.
  983. Vacuum saves a lot of cleanup, but not all. Altogether a great trimmer and a great idea. I've been using mine for about a year and it's still working great
  984. The Trimmer is loud. It is not so easy to adjust the correct Hair size.
  985. Works very well on shaving your genitals sucks up all those little hairs.
  986. This was my second shaver. It replaced a Braun which had a much better build quality (only reason I replaced the Braun was battery life had dropped after 3 years). This one felt lower in quality. Battery life new was flaky, the head is too bulky (due to the vacuum feature) and can't trim evenly under the nose and around the ears. In the end, this got replaced by a Panasonic trimmer which is much higher quality (on par if not better than the Braun).
  987. This beard trimmer falls into the &#34;meh&#34; category for me... it's not terrible but it also doesn't live up to it's much hyped expectations either.<br /><br />PROS:<br />The digital guides make it much easier to know what length you're about to trim to and keeps you from having to keep up with multiple beard guides (which I always lose)<br />The vacuum feature, while somewhat gimmicky, does clean up a fair bit of the trimmed hair... but more on that in the cons below.<br />Charge life is very lengthy and I didn't find myself bringing the charger onto trips with me.<br /><br />CONS:<br />The beard comb provided had a very bad tendency to &#34;snag&#34; on curved areas or looser areas of skin, like under the jaw line. In the worse cases this snag caused the beard guide to be shoved into a lower setting and giving me a &#34;bald spot&#34;<br />The vacuum feature isn't perfect and still leaves quite a bit of hair in/around the sink when trimming (That being said, when I trim my beard I do typically trim a fair amount off)<br /><br />Note: It has been brought to my attention that there is a better beard comb being provided to some people that resolves the snagging problem mentioned above, I did not receive this and therefore have to base my review on what I received.
  988. this is more for hair cuts than beard trimmers unfortunately

  990. I have previously owned the 7100 version of this trimmer, and loved it. This new design trims just as well, and work a lot better in the tight spaces around my upper lip/nose. Though with a 1 hour charge that won't be nearly as big an issue as it was for the 7100, and it's 8 hour charge time!<br /><br />So far I am loving it!
  991. My model 980 battery died last year after a little over 6 years of use. After reading the reviews here, I was hesitant to buy the 4070, and continued using my old one with a cord for several months.<br /><br />Finally, my wife bought me a new one for Christmas last year, and in my opinion, it is better in every way but one than the 980. The flip-open vacuum compartment is not nearly as easy to use as the removable one on the 980, but other than that, ...<br /><br />As some people have mentioned, mine came with both combs.<br /><br />Subjectively, the vacuum catches a little more hair than my old one, though still not all.<br /><br />The biggest improvement for me is the display. My 980 had a tiny window with the number in it, and I simply could not read it without my reading glasses. The new 3/4\\" tall illuminated number makes much more sense in the bathroom.<br /><br />Update 2/12/13: Still waiting for battery to need recharge.<br /><br />Final update 6/17/13: After almost six months using it twice a week, the charge light turned yellow today, so I plugged it in to recharge. I changed my rating from four stars to five.

It is just a cheap poor design destined to fail. I have a rubber band on mine now to keep it closed. I don't see the point in further replacement as it will just fail again due to the poor design. For this reason I will not purchase Norelco again and don't recommend this product.

  1015. My old Norelco was slowly dying so purchasing a new beard trimmer became a necessity. I purposely selected the top of the line model because I don't expect to make this purchase very often.   1016. Good value for not having to clean up clippings from the entire sink area. Ladies if your guy cleans up after himself, it takes a lot of time and is frustrating as we are extremely lazy, this saves it, this is a great gift. It doesn't \\"vacuum\\" up 100% of clippings but a good 90-95% (you'd need a shop-vac attached for the rest) - the remainder is just a splash of water and it's gone. Cleaning the clippers themselves isn't much more work than \\"standard\\" open clippers and the wad of clippings that it catches will surprise you. The charger/power cord is nice and small/light, not bulky at all (no big transformer hanging off the wall plug or a stiff cord), the cutter itself feels nice in the hand, although it must lie flat as there isn't a vertical stand for it. Charge indicator is nice as is the travel (power) lock although I haven't needed it yet. Digital trim length indicator is fine although length is also marked on the sides of the guard/slide. Removing the guard gives access to the clippers directly. The clippers won't give you a 000 length (against the skin), it's more of a 1/16\\", maybe 1/8\\". Overall it seems like a very good design (I've used it for a little over a month) works well, charge lasts quite long and re-charges quickly.
  1017. I got this for Stubble or 5 o'clock shadow look. You do that without a guide on. That it seems to work great.   1020. I bought this to replace my old T980, which was starting to fall apart. On paper, the two devices are very similar. However the T980, sadly no longer available, had a rigid pivoting guide that completely surrounds the blades. This cheaper design has a fixed head that has flexible, pointy tines that approach the blades from either side but leave a large gap over the blades themselves and the vacuum entrance. The result is very uneven cutting length because the tines flex and curved areas of the face can easily enter the gap and make direct contact with the blades. It seems like there aren't a lot of good dedicated beard trimmer options available right now, but I would avoid this one if possible. Hopefully Norelco will redesign this flawed unit soon.
  1021. For what it's for it serves it purpose, I wish it could give a closer trim. But the battery life is amazing only had to charge it once in a while..<br />worth the money, recommend it !!

  1024. Upon opening the box the first thing I noticed is that the product itself is actually just black and white but the image makes it seem like it has a teal tint, if that matters to you.   1025. ### UPDATED ### I purchased this in October 2013, so I have had it for over two years now. I use the trimmer twice a week and just last week it seemed to have slowed down. However, the problem was with the blade as it had gotten a bit sticky. I tried to use some trimmer oil on it and that was a mistake, as it created more drag on the blades. So I soaked just the blade in water-downed dish soap (Dawn), scrubbed it with a toothbrush and now the trimmer works like new. When it does fail, I would purchase this again. ### UPDATED ### ====================== I love the improvements in this model. I keep my beard short, but not stubble length. I use their newer comb and have had no problems with it as other reviewers have had. I actually prefer it to the springy comb that others like. My only complaint is for trimming my mustache, I prefer the narrow trimmer attachment that came with the older model (T980?). Since I still have that attachment, I tried it on the 4070 and it works perfectly. So that problem solved for me. If they provided the narrow trimmer attachment, I would have given this a five star rating.

  1036. Four stars because overall it strikes the best balance between effectiveness and scratchiness. However, it's less painful on sensitive skin than other ones I've used that get a closer shave, so maybe that's just the tradeoff. Because of the width of the head and the plastic bits around the edges of the blade, it's difficult to catch the hairs at the edges and on the contoured parts of the neck. Nonetheless it overall leaves less unevenness than other electric shavers I've used. The vacuuming is good but not perfect - there will still be some hair on and around the sink.

  1041. I have had a Norelco T7500 for years. It is, in my mind, the perfect trimmer, but after many years of use it is starting to wear out. So, I bought the Qt4070 as a replacement.   1042. I honestly don't understand how this trimmer has so many positive reviews... the battery holds a decent charge and the vacuum function somewhat works (not the problem). The trimming experience and the attachments that came with this product are terrible. Without turbo mode turned on the trimmer is useless... it is also very loud. Despite having a ton of length adjustments I still cannot get the desired length I once had with my old trimmer.... the attachment guards I still don't understand... one is a rubberized comb that bends easily and the other a hard plastic guard and both are very inconsistent. I cannot get an even trim with either! When not using the guards you cannot get a good straight edge because plastic covers the blades so you cannot see your lines. I bought this trimmer over a year ago and have only used it several times and it is so bad I had to write a review about it a year later. It has to work for some folks out there but this trimmer is garbage to me.
  1043. I am unable to get an even trim with this product, because there is an open gap in the front where the blades are fully exposed. As a result, the trimmer either trims to a very close stubble length, or does not trim enough, depending on how you angle the trimmer. This is a huge problem. For over $50 I would expect it to give a perfect, uniform trim. Because of this problem, I contacted customer support and was told that a contour following comb(similar to the QT4050), which would eliminate the issues I am having. They offered to ship this comb free of charge. Unfortunately, I keep receiving emails stating that the comb is on backorder, and the shipping date keeps getting delayed further. It is now past the 45 day money back guarantee, and after speaking to customer service again, I was told that they no longer make this part and cannot give me an estimate of when I can expect to receive it. I would love to give the product more stars, but without a contour following comb it is worthless. I just lost $50. Also, according to the description page, the product was supposed to come with a pouch. It did not. Philips/Norelco customer service was very helpful. They sent me a pouch free of charge. I have no idea why Philips/Norelco would sell their trimmer without necessary / advertised parts. If this is how they do business, I will not be purchasing anything else from them. It would also be nice if the product had a stand. Laying the trimmer on its side causes messy trimmings to fall out, and because of its rounded bottom it is impossible to stand upright.

  1056. I am loving this trimmer so far. Mine came with both of the comb attachments, so no issues there, and everything else works as expected. I love the vacuum bit, makes trimming significantly less messy.
  1057. This trimmer works great, and sucks up most of the hair when you put it in turbo mode. It can't pickup everything, but you can't honestly expect that. It does a pretty good job otherwise, though. The best part, is that I was able to use the precision trimming blade from my old Norelco trimmer that died.
  1058. Love the digital display for cutting length. Much easier to remember 10 than 'was it up one notch or two?' The vacuuming of excess whiskers is just a bell and whistle ... not really necessary. I guess it does make cleanup a bit easier. .... I mean there will still be hair everywhere scattered about after use, just slightly less of it.<br /><br />I have been quite happy with this purchase thus far. In the past I've opted for trimmers that used attachments for different lengths with one exception, and that's where the bias against the notch trimmers comes from. It's nice having the trimmer altogether in one piece.<br /><br />I am hoping that it is built well enough to last years of periods with and without beards and/or stubble.
  1059. This Beard Trimmer is absolute junk. I've only used it about six times and the battery is totally gone. And it won't work from the wall plug. I'm done with Norelco products.
  1060. my husband loves this trimmer. he says the battery has a very long life, and the trimmer does a great job of trimming. the adjustable guide &#34;works great&#34; and the canister &#34;collects 80-90% of the hair&#34;.<br />and i'm happy because all that hair doesn't end up on the sink anymore.
  1061. It's a great trimmer. The only thing I would want in a future model is a stronger vacuum. This one picks up a lot of the hair but I am still having a good amount fly everywhere. With that said I think it is a great trimmer for the price, don't let other comments make you think otherwise. I had some concerns when I read some reviews but I just think they're either misusing the product or are just being super harsh.
  1062. I don't write many reviews, but figured this one warranted one (pun intended, as you'll see later).<br /><br />I purchased this unit close to two years ago, despite what any negative reviews said. I've never used the comb, only the contour following piece, so I can't comment on the sharp edges or anything. I have never had any problems with the unit, and it has functioned very well. I use it probably 2-3 times per week to keep my beard in check, and with that the battery usually lasts a month or more. The vacuum catches the vast majority of trimmings, but be sure to rinse your face well afterwards. There have been days I trimmed before heading into work, and I'd notice tiny clippings all over the front of my shirt (the stuff that was stuck in my beard). Only other thing I'd note is that if you use it for trimming chest hair, the compartment fills up pretty quickly and you'll need to empty a few times. Granted, that's why it's billed as a beard trimmer and not a body trimmer.<br /><br />After about a year and a half, I noticed the door on the front of the unit wasn't holding shut very well and as a result the suction power was suffering. There's a tiny plastic tab on the inside of the door that secures it shut, and that had begun to crack. I dealt with it for a month or two, just holding the door shut... and debated on taping it shut or buying a new one. However, I got in touch with Philips customer support first. After a brief 5 minute online chat they shipped out a replacement unit to me! Was planning on this being a 4 star review, but the customer service bumped it up that next level.<br /><br />If you're looking for a good trimmer to maintain your scruff, go with this one.
  1063. This is a nice, lightweight shaver for light-duty trims. The variable trim lengths are super easy to adjust and to read. There are really no surprises with this device. The vacuum actually works really well in it, and it is very easy to clean. My only gripe with it is that it is very loud, when trimming your face near your ears.
  1064. It works great, assuming you move slowly and work the same area several times. I use it everywhere, and this trimmer has been very versatile with a good battery life. The clip that holds the hair trap door broke so I have to keep my fingers on it, otherwise the hair just flies out.
  1065. I am pleased with this trimmer. However, it is my first one so I have no prior trimmers to compare it to. I don't have any regrets, though.
  1066. i have been using this item and so good, if you want to cut you hear this item is so good
  1067. 4 years ago I bought an older version of this as my first amazon prime purchase. So far this one is even better. Slimmer, stronger, better quality. Great trimmer
  1068. this is my second one. i left the first one at a hotel. After a year or so, the latch on the door broke, but that was the only issue. It does a great job keeping the sink clean and provides a precise trim.
  1069. I purchased this item with some trepidation because of several of the previous reviews. However, when the trimmer arrived I had absolutely no issues with it. It came with both heads (beard and stubble). The other main complaint I saw in reviews remarked upon the low quality of the stubble trimmer as well as the harshness of the trimmer. Personally, I have never had a more comfortable trimmer, with or without the heads. The last time I used this trimmer, I actually left off the heads for a closer trim and it was fine. As for the stubble trimmer, you do have to be a little careful of the angle, but it's not very difficult.<br />All in all, I'm very happy with this product.
  1070. It's great for beards but just so so for mustaches.
  1071. It seems like a novel and great idea; the vacuum suction picking up your stubble, a rotating gear to adjust height, a display that shows battery life (what?!). However, it falls short of being a wonderful replacement for my cheapo Remington target pickup of yesteryear (whose own battery has been failing).<br /><br />For 2-3mm stubble trimming I think this product works fine for most parts of your face. It fails at the neckline and moustache areas as you cannot get close enough to the nose to get all of the hairs. The hinge on the vacuum trap also fails quickly; note that I am not one to be manhandling my equipment, especially after learning that others had this same failure, I was determined to not let mine break. Well, it broke. The vacuum itself does an ok job but gets clogged easily and doesn't quite capture everything.<br /><br />Removing the guard, the trimmer is pretty useless for getting a close balding shave of the head. My old Remington does much better with it's guard set on the shortest setting. I'm not sure why this is the case with this trimmer as it seems to shave stubble fine on the cheeks and chin yet falls short (hah!) on the head. The vacuum is also not powerful enough to keep clumps of head stubble from falling everywhere, like a tiny stubbleball they will fall upon shoulders or ears and explode into tiny clusters.<br /><br />Overall, it holds a good charge and does an adequate job on the face. The lack of decent head shave and the hinge breaking easily makes me leave it at 3 stars. For the price I would expect it to do a much better job than the $20 Target pickup from years past.
  1072. This one is really pretty good. I don't really notice the vacuum function until I look down, and there is very little hair in the sink. It will trim tiny beards as well as very thick ones. Trust me, I've done both.
  1073. Scalps patches of hair uneven when using it below 5mm.<br /><br />The plastic guard flexes too easily so no matter what height you have it set to, it will always vary while cutting.<br /><br />I ended up using this for stubble which is 1mm so it cuts even now but you still need to be careful on the jawbone because it will still scalp the area.
  1074. Great little trimmer, but the vacuum function does leave a lot to be desired.
  1075. This is a great trimmer. Works well at cutting my beard and is adjustable in 1 mm increments. It holds it's charge for a very long time and sucks up the trimmings pretty well as long as you remember to empty the cuttings chamber every couple of days. Norelco even but in a second more powerful setting, but the standard power level works just fine for me. It even looks cool and the quality build is top notch!
  1076. So, its now two years later. The trimmer battery is dead and I can't find a replacement battery here on Amazon nor does it appear that replacement was a design consideration to start with. The door of the trimmings chamber has long since lost its latch (though it was repaired numerous times. All in all - as I an experienced user I say its official - this trimmer is a piece of crap that fails to fulfill its advertised promises of a measured length trim, maybe catching 50% of the cut beard, and apparently the trimmer is done when the battery is dead since the company provides no easy method of battery replacement.<br /><br />Did a lot of research before I purchased this beard trimmer. What can I say I make a living researching things. I always read the 1 star reviews first and look at the percentages of 1 star reviews. I have had the trimmer for about a month and used maybe five times. This trimmer seemed to be the best reviewed - with the least serious complaints.<br /><br />Battery - The first charge for three hours and until the lights went out as instructed - had a run time of about five minutes before it was dead. I charged it again until the light went out and it that charged lasted through three ten minute trimmings and still had two bars. The battery now retains a full charge as described in the literature and reviews. Not charging the first time - gave me some trepidation.<br /><br />Cutting - The shearing of the clipper even on regular speed is quite adequate for my beard. I haven't used the turbo to trim with because for my beard it isn't necessary. If the sound is an indication I could trim my hedge with it. The good news is the trimmer has yet to pull my beard - something other brands seems not to manage.<br /><br />Cutting guide/gauge - this part of beard trimmer designs seems to be universally lacking in all brands from my research. This trimmer adjusts well mechanically - but actually guiding and picking up the beard to cut it doesn't function at all- probably narrower gaps between the trim guide comb teeth. My beard lays close to my face and I had to have at least two trims before I managed to get all the longer hairs caught and cut - so don't do what the ad says and throw away your scissors - you'll need them for a perfect trims. I did my first trim at 12 mm and it was the one with the most missed hairs - and a lot of post-trim scissor work. The second I did at 10 mm and that was more accurate in both length and catching errant hairs. My last trim was at 7 mm and that was the best yet. Caught nearly all of the beard. I think this was a result of both my personal beard anatomy, my getting used to the light motion required to cut evenly and I think the trimmer guide/gauge is probably is more accurately functional for shorter settings. In my beard's case I have to go repeatedly in the opposite direction of the beard lay (and a lot of other angles) to get uniform cutting to the gauged length.<br /><br />Trimmer Vacuum - Well... to me this is more of an advertising gimmick than it is an engineering/design success. My beard is light colored and I trimmed it last time with a dark tee shirt on. My estimate that less 50% of my trimmings made it into the trimmings vacuum receiving chamber - the rest was very plainly all over my dark shirt. Oh, and I suggest you wear glasses - I even got beard trimming thrown up in my eyes on occasions. I think the vacuum is great idea, but it will need a better intake design and far more suction before it is really functional.<br /><br />Summary - I only give the trimmer a three star because its performance is a long way from being what is advertised and or perfect. That said, and based on reading hundreds of reviews on other brands of similar trimmers - this may be the best beard trimmer (at least for some beards) on the market today. I'm not sure that is good enough to please a lot of people. I will be keeping the trimmer - and my scissors.<br /><br />Update: Had and used the trimmerfor three months now. I am exceptionally frusturated with the trimmers inability to lift the beard to make accurate cutting. No matter how many times and directions I go over my beard - there are far too many un-cut hairs. Consequently, my beard varies from 8mm - the cut setting - to 20 to 30 mm. because the horribly designed comb simply does not function. My beard trimming now consist of ten minutes of mowing the beard with the trimmer from every conceivable direction - and then another 10 minutes using my comb and scissors to cut all of the beard to the same length. Bottom-line is this product is not market ready, nor does it perform as advertised. I have down graded my original review to two stars and that is generous.

  1089. This is a replacement for my last one that has given up the ghost. Well nearly so anyway, it has a broken door, and the spring loaded comb has come apart several times.<br />This unit works better than the earlier version. I hope it will outlast my first one. The vacuum is better than the earlier one especially with the &#34;Turbo-boost&#34; switch. That switch is press-on, press-off. No need to hold it and it seems to double the rpm of the motor, so assume 1/2 the run time. Still long enough to clean up my beard... It indeed has the spring-loaded comb as well as a fixed one. I haven't used the fixed comb yet but having it means that if the spring loaded one gets damaged you can still use the trimmer. It still leaves a few whiskers in the sink & on my shirt, but not bad as compared the my original unit. Definitely a leap ahead of a trimmer without a vacuum.

  1096. It's great but I would be very happy if I could stop the engine that sucks the hairs
  1097. Love this trimmer, and once you call and get the superior contour comb guard(I have posted images in the product image gallery of the differences between the 2), you'll have a truly great product. It holds it's charge for a veryyyy long time, it feels sturdy and well made in your hand, the LED light is bright and clear, showing you which trim setting you are using, and the vacuum traps nearly all of the hair you have trimmed. My only (minor) complaint is that it showed up in the box with the clearly inferior plastic stubble comb, despite mentioning in the info and on the box that it includes the contour comb. While the part was back ordered for several weeks, it did show up eventually.

  1104. I was skeptical after reading the reviews about this trimmer, but I ordered it anyway. I received my trimmer on April 16, 2012 and it came with not one but two combs. The standard comb, which many people complain about, and the guided comb, which suppose to solve the problems associated with the standard comb.<br /><br />I like the stubble look and I strictly use the trimmer to get a 3mm trim. So, I don't know how it would work if I had longer beard and mustache. I think the standard comb works fine for 3mm stubble trim. I almost nicked myself once while I wasn't paying attention but it is not alarming at all. If you don't pay attention the task at hand, you can get a nick regardless what tool you are using. If you are a careful person, the reviews here shouldn't discourage you.<br /><br />I am not sure when Philips started shipping the second comb with the trimmer but as you can see by the picture I posted here, the unit I received had both combs.<br /><br />The vacuum collects about 80% of the trimmings. Cleaning the trimmer was easy using the included cleaning brush. I wish a case was included in the package to keep everything (charger, extra comb, cleaning brush) together, but it is not a big deal.<br /><br />Charging took more than an hour. I don't know the battery performance yet as I just got the trimmer.<br /><br />I am giving this trimmer 4 star because it feels flimsy. Plastic cover on the front below the trim adjuster dial around the air vents feels loose.
  1105. I just got this in yesterday, and it didn't have the mythical contour comb. I called Philips support and they pointed out that the parts list in the instructions only show the \\"trimming comb\\" which come already attached to the trimmer in the box. This isn't a case that somebody forgot to put it in the box, but more like they don't offer the contour comb with this product anymore. The Phillips website says \\"Contour following comb for a precise and even trim\\" as the first line of the highlights for the QT4070. The QT4050 says the exact same thing, but the picture online for that product clearly shows the pivoting contour comb. The picture for the QT4070 doesn't. Once I pointed that out, the operator agreed that something was weird here. She found the contour comb in their parts catalog, but it showed out of stock, with no date on when to expect it. Since she couldn't get me the part, she's now shipping me a full new trimmer, brand new, in the box. There's no guarantee that the new one will have the comb, but we're rolling the dice. Worse case, I'll try it without the contour and see if I like it. The great part about Phillips, is that they offer a 45 day money back guarantee on their products. Even if my return time is up with Amazon, I can return it to them for a refund if I don't like it. I've actually used this guarantee from them before on an electric razor. They refunded me with no hassle. We'll see what happens with this one.<br /><br />UPDATE: 5 days later, Phillips made good when the replacement trimmer arrived. This one was also brand new, in the box and DID have the contour comb. The box I got with the comb clearly advertised it on the back, so this is an easy way to see if the comb's included without opening the box. The parts listing in the instructions on the replacement clearly showed two combs, rather than the single \\"trimming comb\\" listed in the instructions for the original. This is clearly a feature that Phillips either took out oradded at some point in the production. With the comb mystery solved, I tried the product today and it worked pretty well. I took a guess on the MM equivalent setting for #5 on my T980. The trim was even and the trimmer itself was much more comfortable to hold than the T980. The vacuum was about the same....so-so. It caught maybe 75% of the hairs. As this is the only model I've found with a vacuum feature, I'll take it. Bumping this up to four stars, with the fifth reserved with the hopes of one day having a better vacuum.

This Norelco can't do it nearly as close. :-( Except for that, though, I've moved on to the Norelco QT4070. Battery life is good and it can run on AC as well if plugged in. The Remington won't do that. It will only run if charged. UPDATE - AFTER 3 MONTHS: Two things - (1) With no attachment the blades do get neck about as close as the Remington did. (2) DO NOT TRY TO CLEAN UNDER RUNNING WATER! Yes, the instructions are very clear this unit is not waterproof, but I tried it anyway. MISTAKE.   1132. At first hated this product because if I didn't shave at a proper angle, it would cut most of my beard off. Then I found another clip (black with a clear plastic movable part) in the box and removed the default clip (the all black one with the open end that caused the shaving issues); and it worked perfectly lol! I felt pretty dumb at that point haha. Great product and all of the positive reviews are well deserved. This thing really makes everything best and even. The only minor issue us that the vacuum didn't work quite as good as I was expecting. I did reduce the hair spillage, just not as much as I wanted it to. But I suppose the vacuum would have to be ten times stronger to meet my original expectations.
  1133. Honestly speaking I was afraid to buy this trimmer after reading all the confusing reviews, but then I've decided to go for it and give it a try.<br /><br />I have a beard trimmer from braun that lasted for longer than I can remember, but the battery is dead and I was looking for more precise trimming settings, so I thought it's time for a change. I took my trimmer out of the box (which btw comes with the contour following comb as well), plugged it in to charge while I read the user manual, and took it for a nice smooth drive.... The results?<br /><br />Vacum:<br />It sucked 85% or even more. I wasn't even interested in such feature, but using it I have to say that I am impressed... Please keep in mind that this vacum is put into such small size - you are not carrying the carpet hover in your hands :)<br /><br />Trimmer<br />This thing gives you perfectly EVEN trim everywhere... this was a big issue for me with my old trimmer, and I am more than pleased with this trim... smooth, nice, and even :)<br /><br />Contour Following Comb<br />This is a F***ing great addition to your trimmer. I have used it around tricky places such as my neck, and it serves you good... you might need to choose a different trimming length than with the normal comb, especially if you hold your trimmer in a more angled way like I do.<br /><br />Trim Length Settings<br />18 trimming settings that I think are fabulous, you can choose from 1, 2, 3, 4, 5..., 18 mm with 1mm difference between each setting... Preferably start with long length for the first use and go down step by step - they tell you to do so in the user manual but I was stupid to think it's the same settings as my old trimmer, so I ended with shorter beard than usual.<br /><br />Cons: No Pouch?<br />My only concern is the fact that it doesn't come with a pouch?! seriously philips, charge me an additional 10$ for a decent quality pouch and I would be more than happy to pay for it... fortunately for me, it fits perfectly in my Braunpouch :)<br /><br />Long story short... For the first time in my life, I had my beard professionally trimmed at the comfort of my house.<br /><br />Buy it without any hesitation ;)
  1134. I look to amazon reviews to find out about a lot of products I plan to buy. I have been looking for a good stubble shaver, so as usual I go to amazon to get opinions. To my surprise as nice as the shaver seemed folks were really giving it awful reviews while their were slightly more good ones. Well I rolled the dice and bought it and I want to tell folks who may be on the fence that this shaver is great. Its simple to operate and cuts evenly. In some of the reviews I read people were saying it was cutting their face, I had no such experience. The shaver comes with two guards, and both adjust to the hair length you want with the click of a dial. I use the guard with the piece that contours the shape of your face. I don't write reviews often but this product I believe got a bad rap. It works fine and I would encourage anyone to get it.
  1135. Using it now for one week every day. trimming my stubble to get that 3-5 day no shave look and it works perfectly.   1137. \\"1/64 inch (.5mm) stubble setting\\" Yeah, it doesn't have that. The 'setting' is likely when the trim measuring guard is removed, and you use the bare trimmer on your face. Problem? The plastic for the vacuum gets in the way. It's nigh unusable, and leaves me with much more stubble than a millimeter, which the cheaper Qt4022 can do with ease. (I'll link it at the bottom.) Mine came with two attachments, one you might recognize as the one customers complained about rather frequently in other reviews, and one that some people had to order. I think Philips realized that everyone wanted the original trim guard, so they just started including both. I honestly don't know what the strange guard is even for (pictured here:[...]), since it doesn't seem to work very smoothly no matter what way I used it. If I wanted a trimmer to keep a couple millimeters of hair on my face, or to trim an existing beard, this might work alright. The vacuum was useful when I was testing it, but it got in the way more often than it helped on the low trim settings. The \\"turbo\\" feature was kinda cool, but I don't see why it just wouldn't always be on. Louder, I guess. I had it on pretty much all the time as I tried to trim as much as possible. The last downside is the price. Sure, it has a lithium battery, but for 50 bucks? That puts it in the range of some rather fancy trimming devices. Worst part is that I paid more than that for it a couple months ago, only to (likely) never use it again. Maybe I'll grow a beard or something. I instead picked up the Qt4022:[[ASIN:B004QWST7Y Philips Norelco Qt4022/41 Stubble Trimmer Pro]] This thing works fantastic, as advertised (actually does .5mm trim) to give you the permament 5 o'clock shadow look. It works great, and for less than half the price, I highly recommend it. It works while being plugged in and charged, and is waterproof. NiCd batteries last me about two weeks when I use it daily.
  1138. I was concerned about the previous less than \\"Glowing\\" reviews on this trimmer. My experience has been very good so far. The trimmer now comes with the newer trim attachment which is apparently much better designed than the former large toothed attachment. The trimmer's vacuum does loose a couple of hairs, but a lot less than my old Remington that it replaced.<br />(Even less hairs in the sink when used in the \\"Turbo\\" mode). Very quick to charge, and the charge lasts a long time. The cut quality is great, no problems with pulling or an uneven cut. All my previous trimmers failed due to the Nickel based batteries no longer taking a charge. Hopefully the Lithium-ion battery on this trimmer (Great Upgrade for a trimmer!) will last a lot longer<br />than the \\"old technology\\" Ni batteries.
  1139. Several years ago while living in Florida my son gave me one of the other beard trimmers. It wasn't the one with vacuum on it. My son a couple of years later decided to grow a beard. I have been trying all walmarts and none of them were caring this model anymore. Well just before Christmas this pass year the light in my head came on and that's when I found it with u guys. He loves it and mine is still good except mine rolled off the counter and my hinge on the plastic door broke. I still use it buy just holding the door on while shave and the empty it. I will soon or later buy another one. I would highly recommend this product to anyone else looking for a beard trimmer. Very satisfied and he is too. Thank u very much for helping out. Mike Haggard

  1153. Fans of the late lamented Norelco T980 vacuum beard trimmer will find a worthy replacement in the QT 4070, which does everything the T980 did and offers a better battery and illuminated display in the bargain.<br /><br />For my money this is the best beard trimmer currently available for a number of reasons:<br /><br />* The vacuum feature means no more beard whiskers in the sink. Once you have used a vacuum beard trimmer, you won't want to go back to a trimmer without this useful feature.<br /><br />* The contour comb and dialable length settings make it easy to trim your beard to a consistent length. (Yes, the 4070 now comes with the spring-loaded contour comb familiar to T980 owners; no calls to Philips customer service needed!)<br /><br />* The 980 had a nickel cadmium battery, which cordless appliance owners know is subject to battery memory problems that decrease charge capacity over time. The 4070 has a lithium-ion battery that doesn't share this problem. It also charges fully in just an hour.<br /><br />* The illuminated display shows the trimmer length selected in millimeters, as well as the current battery charge.<br /><br />* The power supply (which folks often refer to as \\"the brick\\") is as lightweight and compact as any I've ever encountered, desirable attributes if you take the 4070 traveling.<br /><br />The only negative I can report is that the 4070 really shouldn't be called a stubble trimmer, as the closest trim using the contour comb is 1 mm. Guys looking for a real stubble trimmer might consider the Man Groomer Scruff Sculptor, which trims down to a third of a millimeter, but which also suffers from some unfortunate functional and ergonomic deficiencies.<br /><br />The 4070 is a much more polished product than the Scruff Sculptor and represents a much better value as well.<br /><br />Perhaps the next generation of Norelco vacuum beard trimmers will trim closer. Until then the 4070 is the beard trimmer of choice.
  1154. Works great and the vacuum makes clean-up much easier (no complaints from my wife about wayward hairs).<br /><br />Beware, the closeness settings are calibrated in mm. and are not the same as the arbitrary units used by many other trimmers, so use a not-very-close setting to start with until you get a feeling for the settings or you may end up with a shorter beard than you planned.
  1155.   1178. The Qt4070 is the updated version of my old Philips Norelco Turbo beard trimmer. So, I am still using the old one and counting the days until my new part shows up for the new model. Bummer!<br /><br />After three months Fox Industries contacted me directly to take care of the back-ordered part issue. My Amazon credit card info had an expired date on it so Amazon quit processing it. Thank goodness Fox followed up and figured out what the problem was or I would still be waiting for the part. It came quickly and I am very happy with the Qt4070 now, it is quiet and powerful and trims my beard safely and comfortably. So the only problems were with customer service, not the product itself.
