  1994. It's everything I had hoped for great beard trimmer
  1995. If James Bond had a beard, he'd trim it with one of these. More precise and better feel than the Conair.
  1996. Gave this to my husband in December and it broke already in March. When I say it broke I mean that it randomly turns on (both when its plugged into the wall charging and when it is unpluged) and you can't remove the battery so it is a fire hazard as it will become warm after being on for a period of time. It worked well in terms of the shave but after only having it for a 3 months it started turing itself on randomly. We are very disappointed.
  1997. This does not meet my expectations. It is poorly designed and cheaply constructed. The &#34;depth head&#34; is uncomfortable moving across your beard or face. The cutting &#34;blades&#34; are very difficult to use for trimming: difficult to see in the mirror, first of all, because of the design, and difficult to just use because of how they sit in the housing. The cheap construction has not made an impact, but it will. The touted &#34;collection&#34; of shaven hair might be mildly useful, if it actually worked. About 1/3 of the hair does not get pulled into the collection area. If have to clean the sink of hair anyway, it doesn't really matter if it's three times as much. So why did I give it 2 stars instead of one? Well, it is usable, if you work at it. Hairs will be cut, and they might even be cut the length you want (if you work at it).
  1998. I have been using this trimmer for almost 3+ months. Initially i loved it as it replaced my aged trimmer which was not doing a good job. But after a few weeks i have second thoughts of this trimmer. Background : i keep a 3-4 mm beard in general with occasional 2mm cut.<br /><br />Pro:<br />- Vacuum is a little effective with pulling in next to 70-80% hair in the trimmer<br />- holds good charge and overall does a decent job trimming<br />- no pulling<br /><br />Cons:<br />- Loud has hell ( wife hates it)<br />- not washable which i think is a deal breaker as it is tricky to clean after use. there is a dingy brush which i lost already.<br />- there are times when one may feel it trims unevenly<br />- cant get hard to reach areas ( under nose etc) or do a precision cut with blade on. My old trimmer did it will as the settings were without comb<br /><br />Unfortunately for me the return window is long gone so i ended up buying another trimmer after 3 months of this use. For what its worth, try another trimmer and dont go for vacuum marketing it is a OK feature coz you still need to clean 20% of the dirty sink, might as well clean 100%. My 2 cents, get a trimmer which is quieter and can atleast be washed under running water. For me it makes a lot of difference. I ended up buying Conair for Men® i-Stubble® (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004PXIR1W/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o02_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1) . I havent used it yet but this one will be shelved.
  1999. I have very thick whiskers and sensitive skin. I used to shave using the fusion pro glide and would eat through a cartridge in 2 weeks. This is an awesome product. The vacuum picks up about half the hair on normal, and maybe 80 percent on turbo mode. Easy to clean out, I use a fingernail brush, and just takes a quick swipe. I regularly apply a small amount of vegetable oil to blades as well, and the trimmer hasn't bit me yet, even unguarded (just be slow and steady). Can use it daily, and in combination with some trimmers, I can be done in 2 minutes.<br /><br />Great product, great price. I'm very happy with this purchase, and would recommend to another.
  2000. I really tried to like this thing. I take very good care of my stuff. I've had this thing for around a week. When I was shaving at (I think 3mm) I noticed in the mirror the LED length display was flashing between 3 and 4mm. so I stopped and made sure that it was locked into place and everything seemed OK and the screen quit flashing. Well to make a long story short the calibration of the LED screen to the plastic guard was thrown off somehow. When I clicked the guard as low as it could go it read &#34;2MM&#34; on the LED screen, but was actually in the 1MM slot. I could not get it to click down to say &#34;1MM&#34; After playing with it for 10 minutes I moved the guard out as far as it could go (to the 18MM or whatever mark) and all the way back down, and sure enough I was back at 1 frickin MM on the display. Not sure exactly when everything was thrown off but my scruff looks like garbage right now, and the length is so low I cant fade it or anything. After playing with it for a little while more I noticed the guard does bend a little bit when you put pressure on it too. The vacuum didnt pick up a whole lot either. It actually takes longer to clean with the vacuum because I have to detail the vacuum chamber with a small brush on top of just swishing some water around in the sink and using a piece of toilet paper to mop up any hairs around the sink. Rumor has it the vacuum chamber door breaks after a while too. The blades on this thing are cheap, which I tried to overlook, but my little Wahl Lithium ION has way nicer blades.<br /><br />How about you dump the gimmicks, such as the LED display, Vacuum, and Turbo Button and just make a nice shaver that works? Quality Blade? Quality Guard? Etc?<br /><br />I have the Wahl lithium Ion groomsman as well and it is great, except when I try to use it for scruff the guard comb just rips hair out of my face, however I think I saw a WAHL stubble trimmer and I might just buy one of those.<br /><br />I've bought 100 things off of amazon and this is the first thing that has actually made me angry
  2001. Best Beard trimmer ever! Nice Norelco design.<br />Great price on Amazon - I know I did a lot of research.
  2002. Loved this. Gave it as a gift for Christmas but has stopped charging. Tried a similar charger from his old one. No more charging after 3 months.
  2003. Don't waste your money. I'm on line to replace this unit I bought about 1 year ago. I read reviews before purchasing but thought it would not happen to me. But the clasp for the trim container did break and I am now using a rubberband to keep it shut. For some reason after charging it also drains out and I still have to use the cord to trim with. I'm back to Remington!
  2004. I tried this on numerous occasions and it consitently missed hairs or left whole areas much longer or much shorter than everywhere else. I tried repeatedly going over and over the same spots from different directions. After my face was rubbed raw from these attempts I gave up and returned it. I need something that trims my beard and despite it's name, this failed to do that for me.<br /><br />Pro's: Vacuum collected most (not all) of the hair.<br /><br />Con's: The contour following guide has a gap in the middle so it stabs you and allows certain areas to trim too closely. The vacuum puts a gap between the blade and the guard so it is a little awkward/unusable trying to get a close/accurate trim from that direction.
  2005. The adjustable head on this beard trimmer was exactly what I was looking for. I didn't want to carry around multiple clips that I would have to attach to the clippers. The cut is really good, and the contour attachment makes cutting under my chin a lot easier.<br /><br />I was disappointed in the vacuum capabilities of this trimmer. While it does catch a lot of hair, there is still a good amount that falls in the sink, and the way the head is designed, the hair keeps getting caught where the vacuum sucks the hair in. This blocks the clipper and you have to remove the hair before you can keep cutting.<br /><br />Other than that the trimmer works well, and I highly recommend for travel!
